text:
The new king of Chicago style deep dish pizza in Las Vegas!

In my quest to find the best Chicago style pizza I try to taste any establishment that offers true deep dish pies. I stumbled upon Windy City while browsing Yelp (hooray!) and am I glad I found it!

Windy City is located on a nice corner with a small plaza out front. The interior is spacious and casual with Chicago memorabilia.

On to the important stuff: Chicago style deep dish pizza. Best I've tried in Las Vegas.

 The crust is thick enough to hold the toppings and has an amazing buttery taste. The sauce is definitely a highlight, tangy, sweet and flavorful, next time i'll order some extra sauce to use on pasta! The cheese is creamy and tastes very fresh. If you order additional toppings you can rest assured the guys at Windy City don't hold back, they just pile the toppings! As always if you order a deep dish pizza, give it at least 10-15 more minutes than a traditional pizza. Good (and big) things take time...

The service is great, I was greeted with a smile and the staff was very pleasant to deal with.

Good pizza, thin style and chicago style, Fun place with awesome Chicago brick decor. Friendly staff. There's a few things restaurants should never charge their customers....like ranch sauce for French fries, not good.

This place is a fun little hole in the wall.  We came for the pizza.   Beware by the slice has limited hours.   They took a long time so we went to the front to ask and they said they forgot our slices and they were burnt.   We were told we had to wait longer for new slices.   It was a little annoying considering we had already waited a long time.  We watched three other families get there cooked food while we waited for two slices of pizza to be heated up.  Soda is served in styrofoam cups which is a little bit of a turn off to me.  We love that they have paper towel rolls on the tables!   The pizza was really good despite the long wait for slices of pizza that were already made. I would recommend this for tasty food.   The operation needs some improvement if they want to stay competitive.   Can't wait to try more another time.

Been here twice now and both experiences were excellent. Now I'm not a expert in Chicago style hot dogs but they were delicious! Definitely going to be returning. Also prices were cheap for the quality of the food.

Had the Italian beef sandwich & it was awesome. This place has the best Chicago food here. I'm from there and this place reminded me of all the good food I was missing out on. I will be going here every week now, it's that good!!!
Great pizza lots of toppings!  But I prefer thin crust New York style.  Sandwiches are skimpy on the roast beef meat, and pretty bland and flavorless.  Customer service average at best.

Damn this shit is the bomb
Drove from Lake Las vegas 
Will make sure to keep doing so !

Numbet 10 is all you need to know !

After reading all the reviews took the family out to try, what a awesome place got the Italian beef with everything dipped sooooo good. Also got all meats deep dish what can I say except I found my new joint. The only negative I would say is the it ruined pizza for me from other places. Set the bar to high!!!!!!!

Yes this is a pizza joint, but I was sent to review the burger as I often do, so here you go:

This particular iteration is located on Eastern just south of the 215 in your average Vegas strip mall. It's tucked in the corner behind an outdoor seating area identified with some fairly small signage. If I wasn't specifically looking for it I probably never would have seen it. The interior is filled with your standard plain pizza restaurant furniture, and fully decorated with plenty of Windy City sports team memorabilia. The menu predictably includes plenty of options involving hot dogs, pizzas, sausages, as well as burgers, wings and fingers.

I went with the #6 Windy City's Burger & Fries: "a mouth watering 100% all beef patty with lettuce, onions, tomato & pickles. Special sauce served on sesame seed bun." My burger was brought to me in a red plastic basket; I've hated this choice over a plate in the past, but it turned out to be large enough to work ok this time. The bun was a bit too large for the patty that was within, but it was very flaky and fresh. The meat had almost a questionable light grey color to it, but was somewhat flavorful and cooked well. It was not quite one of those patties you'd order medium rare, but still ok. The pickles and LTO were all good; fresh and just enough of each. The special sauce was kind of salty, and I'm not sure what it was exactly. I wasn't too crazy about it, but luckily it was only present in some spots. This was a messy burger, very juicy and not dry. Overall it was decent but nothing to go out of your way for.

The fries were of the very generic frozen variety, but they were cooked so well that I still enjoyed and ate them all. They were presented in a brown paper bag; I'm not sure if this is a tradition in Chicago or something? The #6 is a very reasonable $5.95. I was charged $8.86 so I assume this included another $1.75 for the fountain drink I ordered, and is apparently not included in the meal combo pricing. For a typical strip mall pizza restaurant this was a decent burger, but I think it's the same that you would get from probably any pizza restaurant in town so I can't say its worth going out of your way for. Still, if your friends or family are demanding pizza and you feel like eating something else, it's not the worst burger in the world.
This is much better than competing pizza places. The food is excellent, as is the service, and I would recommend this to anyone, anywhere.

Groupon had 14 inch deep dish, 2 salads, and 2 cannolis for a great price.  Never had deep dish Chicago pizza.  Was really good.  The salads were ok.  Will try the cannoli later:).  Well worth the price.  Really great service service by Tina.

This place is awesome My girlfriend and I have been searching for a all around pizza joint and this is it lol. the wings are fantastic there perfectly cooked and to be honest they don't even need sauce that's how u know  there good lol the deep dish is excellent has a mildly sweet tomato sauce but is very bold in flavor, the crust is my Ideal crust it's crunchy but still chewy lol it's pretty bomb!! Along side the great food was the staff there super friendly and gave us attention as soon as we walked in wouldn't change a thing

Ok, I am from NY and still searching for true NY style pizza with no luck. My friend is from Chicago so he brought me here. It really is quite good, not sure what qualifies it for Chicago status but the thin crust sausage pizza and chicken wings were good. Everything is freshly made and served piping hot.

I tried this place based on the reviews. I got the Chicago deep dish. Horrible. TNot enough cheese, bad crust, horrible sauce, not enough sauce. I mean crappy, Pizza Hut would be better than this. Definitely not a good Chicago deep dish pizza. Still haven't found a good one in Vegas or henderson. Best I have had was Masa in echo park in SoCal.

Good food but rude, bad attitude both over the phone and in person. What made me finally post a review is that I just got hung up on while trying to place a order over the phone. So I called Buffalo Wild Wings instead.

Ever since Chicago Tasty Dogs closed I thought I wouldn't find any place in Vegas close to me where I can get some quality Chi-Town eats whenever I felt homesick. I was very happy to find out that Windy City opened up in literally the same area. Once you walk inside you're met with a lot of Chicago-based memorabilia adorning the walls, so it really did make me feel at home. The staff are all really nice and are always a pleasure to see whenever I visit.

Here you will not only get Chicago style dogs (made with Vienna beef, nonetheless), but also other city staples like Maxwell St. Polish sausage, Italian beef sandwiches, Davenco gyros, and even Eli's cheesecake. As expected you can get deep dish pizza, but growing up it was all about Chicago style thin crust for me and they definitely do it right here: a crispy crust and cut in squares. And one thing I like to do here is, instead of just ordering the chili cheese fries, get a basket of fries with a cup of chili on the side to use for dipping.   

I find it odd how many Chicago food establishments are suddenly popping up all around Vegas. However, this place continues to be my personal favorite. And you don't have to come from the Windy City itself to enjoy this place. I've taken several people here who're unfamiliar with Chicago food and I've heard nothing but compliments. It's just a simple quaint place with a friendly atmosphere and good food, and that's all that really matters!

I'm from Chitown, I'm incredibly picky especially when it comes to the food--  I mean I will give you the stink eye if you dare put ketchup on my hotdog. Maxwells used to be 20 min from my house and I've never known hotdogs to be made any other way.  My husband and I were homesick and hoping to find something that would remind us of home--This in my book is the closest I've seen in Chicago type foods since I've moved here. The beefs are awesome and staff was cordial. We'll be back when we get homesick again.

Awful customer service. We just went to pick up our order and when we asked for the special on the sign they would not honor it. Tacky decor. Don't waste your time or money here. Food is average at best.

Keeping this review short...

I have had the Italian Beef Sandwich twice, and the Foot Long Chili Dog today. 

The reason for no 5? Inconsistency? The first time I had the Beef Sammie, it was GREAT. Lots of delicious beef and cheese, and peppers and that jarsomething deliciousness these Chicago people put on everything, YUM! The second time? Bland. Not impressed. 

I also think they can be slow to get your order in if there is more than 1 order ahead of you. I would like to think it;s because everything is made fresh? ;) 

The chili dog was good, not the best I have had to be honest, the chili cheese dog from Sonic is 10000x better LOL..


Anyway, I am new to these Chicago-style anythings, but slowly it is winning me over. :) 

Try it, it;s good shit. If you know Chicago food, I'd be curious to hear your opinion.

I found this gem and tried it out thanks to a Groupon. Best. Deal. Ever. Because now I have a favorite pizza place close to my home. 

The deep dish is delicious, even better than the "authentic" deep dish pizzas that I have eaten in Chicago. Windy City Beefs N Pizza does everything right: sweet crust, delicious sauce, inches of cheese, loaded with toppings (try the sausage, you will thank me). 

While waiting for your order, the Chicago memorabilia that decorates the walls is a great way to pass the time (and keep your mind off your growling stomach).

My boyfriend is from the "Chicago" area he brought me a piece of pizza that reminded us of Uno's (the original NOT the chain). It was delicious, I went back a few days later & was sad to discover that you can't get a slice after 4pm. I tried the wings they were average but quite a few people came in excited to order and telling me what I should order next time. I look forward to going back and trying a pizza puff.

Food is so good!! The service is now excellent! The last time I came here the lady that was up front was awful and rude. They have replaced her with someone new and she is so sweet! It's actually nice to be here and not have someone give you an attitude! Definitely the best Chicago joint around! Eat here!!

Went here on a Thursday morning to try their hot dogs because I've been eyeing this place for awhile. I walked inside and no one greeted me.. I was the one that greeted them, and no one replied. 

When I eat hot dogs, I just like it plain. Literally just the bun and the hot dog inside. & that is the same case with my cousins. Then we'll have all the ingredients on the side to put in our hot dogs so we can control the ingredients that we want to put. But this is the ONLY hot dog place I know that can not give a PLAIN hot dog. They said they can't put it on the side when the ingredients are removable. Apparently she said that it has to be on it and I did not hear it so I came to her and told her I thought everything was on the side, so she gave off a rude vibe and said she already told me once that it has to be on the hot dog.

Needless to say no one ate the hot dogs. My cousins only ate the fries. Customer service is okay,- and the ambiance is good. I'll probably go back to try their pizzas and give it another try.

I dont even know if 1 star is worth it.  Read the reviews good and bad but still decided to try it out.  Called to place a delivery order and the older lady that answered the phone was extremely rude and rushed me.  Did not feel comfortable placing a order here.  Just had a feeling of carelessness.  NO THANKS.

I've never been to Chicago, so perhaps I'm a tad baised to this favorite place of mine. It's a utterly comfortable hang-out for lots in this neighborhood, and it's always busy- full of happy, well-fed former Chicagoans and those in the know. My faves have to be the thin pizza, the Italian beef dipped sandwiches (so so good!) and the surprise of them all, the best canolli for dessert I've ever ever had. Yes, better than Freed's in the same shopping center. The cream inside the shells seems to me..to be made with powdered sugar, so it's very smooth and silky. Just amazing! Plus, everyone who works here is so friendly and provide great service. You go, and have a happy tummy!

Awesome Food Excellent Deep deep Dish Thin Crust Just As good 
My Only complaint Is That it is Very warm In The restaurant Please fix The Air This is The desert

Been looking forward to trying this place, since I owned a similar place (Chicago Hot Dogs) in Nor Cal several years ago. First off - the snot, rude (see Brittany N review) lady behind the counter - are you kidding me? Who do you think you are? I almost walked out, she was such a B**ch. Hands my change back to me, and I say thanks. She says nothing, turns away. I asked the kid - hey did I piss her off by coming in? Got my food and left. I am going back, and if she acts like that again I am going to unload on her verbally. 2 can play the pissy game, lady!
Hands down the best taste of Chicago in town! This place is a MUST! Awesome service, awesome food, and very reasonably priced.

Windy City Beef N' Pizza is a lot of fun. The food is decent. I've never been to Chi-town, but it seems to represent it well. If I'm in the mood for a hot dog or slice of deep dish pizza I know where to go.
Ate here today didn't really care for the pizza to much... the beef sandwich was pretty good make sure to get it with the spicy peppers.. all and all I will probably just come back for the sandwich!!

Long overdue for a review for this excellent establishment in Henderson, NV. We've been to several "Chicago styled" deep dish pizza (ddp) places in my days from Chicago to California. I have to say that outside of Chicago, probably the best deep dish pizza place we've been to. IMO the sauce and crust are what differentiates between a good and great ddp. Their pizza tasted little 'healthier' (less heavy and greasy) than other places, even most places in Chicago. The owners are also very friendly. Just a little advice, if you're planning to dine in: It takes a good 45 minutes to cook so order ahead and enjoy.

Ordered two hot dogs with fries, the hot dogs were great but the fries smelled like fish. A recommendation to the owner please cook your fries in oil dedicated to fries. The four star rating is for the hot dogs. I maybe could give the fries 1/2 a star at best.

I give this pizza place 0 stars for the rude and abrute customer service they have. I don't care how good their food is and I don't know if it is any good. As far as I'm concerned customer service is part of yoir experience and is a huge turn off there.

Seriously, this place is doing it right.

Staff is awesome & the food always delivers. Been coming here since shortly after they opened, the second time I came in the older gentleman who I believe is the owner remembered me by name! WOW. 

I've had several different things here.
Pizza- not from Chicago but I am clearly missing out but I am fortunate to have this place for a slice of pie. 
Chicken Fingers- yummy. Nothing special but above average.
Chicken Finger Sandwich- This was a special one day & I loved it.
Their french fries are pretty darn good too.
They also have a nice selection of soda pop (yes I call it soda pop, I am from the east coast) I tried the Black Cherry soda from Dr Browns. Ammmmazing. 
Nice to have options when it comes to beverages.
The staff is usually pretty friendly & food never takes too long.

I tried the deep dish Chicago style pizza and it was delicious. The service is great at this restaurant. The team is very friendly and helpful. Even the customers remind me of the Midwest hospitality. I definitely recommend.
Great pies and sausages from this place, this place will take a while to make the pizza but very good and saucy!
Just discover these guys, great deep dish pizza, true Chicago style. Only thing that could have done to get 5 stars would be to have more toppings on the pizza.

Bought the groupon to give this joint a try.  The food was fresh and yummy.  The groupon was for 2 salads, a 14" deep dish and 2 cannolis.  The salads were non-descript except way too much onion.  The pie though...holy moly was it good! You can taste the freshness in their food!  I wish I had read the menu before because I would have had them put giardenera (spelling) on it!  A little messy, you have to use utinsels to eat but what self-respecting chicago deep dish is eaten with a fork?!?  Only had 1 slice each and we were stuffed!  I will be having again for dinner the next night :-)  The cannolli was delish!  Ate mine and told my husband he probably wouldn't like it so he should give me his.  It didn't work!  We will definitely be going back and made sure to grab a menu so I could call ahead and pick up after work!  Would recommend at the drop of the hat.  Thank goodness for groupon because I might have missed this joint.

I had been looking for a good Chicago pizza here in Vegas.  This it totally it! The pizza was awesome- since the 1st time I went I have been back about 4 times in last 6 weeks. The staff is also very friendly. Great food and great staff!

Great deep dish pizza, absolutely will come back to have another. The 14 inch pizza on its own was more than enough for me and the wife.  Loved the venue, Chicago sports is well displayed. Staff was very friendly.

I think THIS is our favorite restaurant in Henderson. They do delicious food very well. No pretense. Pleasant service and flavorful fare.

My husband loves the deep dish pizza and comes here frequently when we are in Vegas. I just enjoyed the sausage and beef combo sandwich. They accommodated my diet easily. I got tons of delicious grilled onions mixed in with the meats and scooped it out of the roll. 

We've been coming here for three years and it's always a highlight of our vacation.

I have been searching for Chicago style deep dish QUALITY pizza since I moved to Vegas and this is the ONLY restaurant who lived up to expectations.  There are other restaurants in the City that claim to serve Chicago style pizza, but the crust is not right nor is the sauce, etc.  Windy City does it RIGHT!  I just wish they had a location near Summerlin!!  VERY GOOD and I recommend them highly for pizza!
A must visit hole is the wall. Their pizza is amazing, probably the best pizza I've ever had.

Outstanding friendly service. Pizza Wow! Hot dogs yummy and french fries in a bag, cute and shake it up with ketchup oh yeah!  Restaurant Chicago style.  Families of all ages. Ice cold beers.  Everything reasonable prices. We ordered delivery to our home and pizza piping hotttt. Excellent!  I can't wait til Friday night, were gonna try the pepperoni.
Beef very good but the pizza sauce was just okay to me..I prefer NY pizza!

Born and raised in Chicago I had high hopes for this place and I wasn't disappointed!  It would have received 5 stars if their Gyro was right off the spit.  The Wings are amazing, their burgers are delish and you can never go wrong with French fries served in a brown bag!!!!  
It's a cross town but I will be back to indulge in their pizza next. 
Until next time......Peace, Love & Angels
The pizza is authentic Chicago style and the best I've had outside of my own kitchen. The deep dish and thin crust pizzas are excellent. Solid flavor on the sauce. The dogs are great as well.

I would give them 4 stars the little lady with dark red hair working the front was VERY rude. She kept giving me the stink eye because I grabbed a plate. Like, sorry you have to wash them maybe you should invest in paper plates, so it doesn't hurt you to see a plate being used. 
Anyways thank god for their pizza.

Well I went there the other night just after 10.pm  4  a cannoli 
The counter girl "oh is that all you having?!" I ask how big are they she answered regular size with a WHATEVER! attitude. 
Never really make eye contact with me !
Multitasking. ... I don't think so just felt kinda like I was a broke ass dude .
10 seconds later the cannolis ready ..
well went we star eating was soggy not fresh .
One the worst I ever had .
I may return to have a deep dish pay and give them a chance to earn some stars......

Visiting from Cali, found this place while coming up the 215.   Had the WCBNP Specialty pizza, and its freaking delicious!  Deep dish pizza that's not super greasy.  The tomato sauce is light and tasty, and the crust makes it all work.  Well done!!
Overall expected a lot more. Got a thin crust with extra toppings and the pizza was soggy and not something to write home about. We ordered the wings and the same thing.   Sprite was good though

Disappointing experience trying to use Groupon purchase. Unfortunately due to illness, our original Groupon deal had expired, but it clearly stated that the original amount paid $15 would never expire. No where on the Groupon print out does it state that it has to be used for the same items. But when we stopped by to use it on lunch, they declined the $15 voucher and said that we'd have to apply it to a specific meal. The frustrating thing is that the manager at the time couldn't even tell us the price of the meal. We gave up and left. 
I have no idea if the food is good, but the customer service drove away customers.
We pick up a Chicago style pizza. It was the BEST. The sauce is excellent. Pepperoni and sausage is my favorite.

It's been six months that I've been eating thin crust pizza from Windy City. It was time to delve into the Deep Dish. I've eaten the sausage ($18.75), and two specialty pizzas ($21.50): WCBNP and the meat lovers. All are great, but the meat lovers is my favorite. The deep dish here isn't overly thick which I love because I like a good crust to sauce to toppings ratio. They get it right. The crust is buttery and delicious; it crisps beautifully so it can support the weight of the toppings (weak crust is another pet peeve). Toppings are fresh and so many combinations are possible. And it reheats well in the oven or toaster oven.

They have 50-cent wings on Tuesdays. I've finally tried those now, too. They are meaty, never greasy, yet super crispy. My preference is the Chicago hot, with no ranch or blue cheese. It has a nice kick and it's loaded with flavor. It's nice to actually taste hot wings.

They've had awesome specials for Blackhawks games, like buy a pizza, get one free. And coming up July 4th. They'll have .99 dogs (at both locations) with a soft drink purchase. Talk about a deal!

Not sure what the hype is about this place. Ordered the beef sandwich and found it to have little to no flavor. Sandwich was a pretty decent size, though. They also serve the Supreme tamales here which I miss dearly.

Just had Windy City beefs N pizza and all I can say it was excellent! I had the #10 which is the Italian beef. You get enough beef on the sandwich to fill up 2 sandwiches. I also had the chili cheese fries, perfect portion and great flavor all for $10! I will definitely be going back there soon!

First time here, very happy with the pizza. I have been to Chicago but have never had a deep dish, so I couldn't tell you if it was authentic or not. What I can say is that it was very good. Not too greasy, nice and filling, very tasty. Sauce tastes home made, which is a big plus. We had a groupon, which made everything free! Well, it worked. We will surely be going back to support this business with real money, asap :)

Ordered two italian beef dipped sandwiches. They were the best I ever had. The lady taking orders was so friendly and attentive. Service was quick and helpful. The place was clean and organized. Would highly recommend.

Love all the staff here.  I'm here so often the owner asks me if he should start my pizza or sandwich when he sees me in line!  That's service.  The owner Tim always comes out and hugs my mother when she comes in and high fives my kids.  Yeah I'm from Chicago and this place is the real deal!  Vienna beef dogs, S Rosen buns, Neon green relish, celery salt, Tims homemade Italian beef is better than I get in Chi town!   And no, don't put ketchup on a hot dog!

Authentic. Hotdog was spot on Chicago style. Steamed poppy seed bun was outstanding. Italian beef and sausage combo didn't hit the mark. Hard bread. Dry beef (although ordered wet). Based on other reviews, I was more excited to go here than I should have been. Overall I bit disappointing. Cashier was rude and short with customers. Arrogant.

Being from Chicago, it took me a long time to find good Chicago type comfort food such as authentic chicago hot dogs, maxwell polish, Italian sausage/beef/combo sandwiches, thin crust pizza and deep dish pizza.  We found out about this place at their first location up by Summerlin and was bummed out when we moved out to Henderson. You can imagine the excitement we got when this location opened up and also served PIZZA. They even have pizza puffs and tamales (All they need now are Chicago Ribs-lol)  This place definitely hits the spot for your Chi-town faves.  The place is a good size (largest of the other locations) and is decked out with Chicago memorabilia.

So, if you want a taste of Chicago, they do it very well along with a few other "Chicago" inspired restaurants in town...this just happens to be in my neighborhood.

The only thing as good as the food, are the people.  Friendliest staff I've ever met, and food that will make your knees weak.  Have the beef sandwich "wet."  My knees get weak just thinking about it.

Had eaten here once and liked the food even though it was super crowded on a game night. Thought it would be a great place for client needs and called the restaurant to speak with a manager or owner. Whoever answered the phone had the worst customer service personality I've ever had to deal with. She apparently wasn't a manager or owner but felt she had the authority to shoot down any business I might want to send their way. Finally she says to email and the owners or managers would call. I asked for the email address and she says go to the website. Frustrated I say thank you and hang up then call back to find out who I'm supposed to address my email to. She says "to whoever" and I say "so there isn't a person with a name that can help me" and she says "I'm not authorized to give that information out". I ask "you're not authorized to give me a managers name" and she says "just email and if they're interested they'll have a look". I ask if I'm bothering her by trying to send customers her way and rather than change her tone she just says "no not at all". Unbelievable. Will never come back. Good hot dogs aren't worth crappy service.

If this is what Chicago deep dish pizza is about, then New York Pizza will always be number ONE.  The pizza was so bland.  Theres more flavor with a microwave pizza.  The three of us each ate a slice, and left the rest of the pizza on the table and left.  We went next door to nothing bundt cakes and we were so much happier with that.

Not bad but I have had better chicago style pizza. Went based on reviews but not sure I would go back. The pizza was not quite cooked all the way through but it was a littke busy so I can chalk it up to lunch rush. On the fence....might givr it another a fes months from now.

This gem is one I tell all my friends and family who come visit Vegas! I am simply in love with this place!!! Atmosphere and staff = fun, energetic, friendly. But not the kind of friendly you typically expect. They are looking to form real friendships/bonds with their customers. I've been here twice and I can already tell that they truly value their patrons. They have a lot of regulars and I don't blame them! 

First time, we had the Chicago style deep dish pizza with Italian sausage, mushroom, and onions. And oh man, SO GOOD!!! I have to tell you that I've sampled Chicago style everywhere -- from LA to SF to Chi town! And I have to say that this is on par -- if not better -- than the ones I tried in Chicago! Everything is well-balanced, cheese is OOEY-GOOEY GOODNESS, and they do not skimp on the meat. Everyone who knows pizza... knows that toppings are important, but what is equally important is the crust! And boy, this one delivers. Its soft, flavorful, yet crispy. 

I can't wait to try the hotdogs and gyros next! 

I recommend eating the pizza there though. I took one to go and though it was still good... it wasn't as good as when we sat there and dined in. Reheating in the oven helps a bit! But it is best right out the oven! 

Also, my bf is a huge Chicago Cubs fan -- and I think we found THE spot to watch games. I love the atmosphere. Everyone is a die-hard fan of anything Chicago! It makes all games that much more fun to watch amongst Chicagonians.

As good as it gets! Awesome prices,great chicago dogs ,beef  sandwiches and deep dish pizza. They always have a special going for a game or event. The staff remembers your name when you walk on and its always great service for take out or dine in. Plus they just got beer!

Always in search of a true Chicago Dog, I was pleasantly surprised when I discovered this place on our trip to Las Vegas. Walk through the door and you've stepped into a Vienna Hot Dog, Chicago experience. The food was great, service with a smile, the banter between the owner and staff priceless, and the whole experience took me back home. 
Had to have the Chicago Dog with fries and a pop (Coke, yes!) and shared the tamale with chili and cheese and of course onion. Both were perfect. Wish I could have had the Italian beef because it looked great and saw many people chowing down on them, but just too much food.
Needless to say, I'll come back on every visit to Vegas.
You can't go wrong here. Beef sandwich is really good, I think it's the best in town. Hotdogs a great as well add $.50 wings on Tuesday and you can't go wrong. The employees are super nice as well!!!

Hit Windy City on a return trip from AZ back to Mountains Edge - I was hankering for some pizza and i remember seeing a recent posted review and pics of windy city so why not give it a try ?  I'm a fan of the Chicago style thin crust pizza so i opted for a medium with sausage and pepperoni.  Also picked up a foot long chili dog ( includes a sack of fries ) 

The pizza  - nice crunchy crust with the graininess of the added cornmeal bottom ( which i like ) the sausage tasted great, probably a little more cheese than i prefer but not a bad thing.  The sauce - decent - strong oregano  taste.  And as usual, i dig the square cut as opposed to the standard slice cut.

The chili dog - a tasty mess !  Homemade chili ( no beans ) onions, cheese and mustard - ALL GOOD.  The sack of fries - nothing special.

Total cost - $26.50 ( not sure of breakdown cost between pizza and chili dog ) 

Price seems a little high so i've dinged them one star.  Overall, I like the place and may try again if in the area.

Ordered a deep dish pizza for pickup tonight. We loved it so much that we will try to get there at least once a month because we live way over near Summerlin. I'm really hoping they will open one on our side or somewhat closer. We are native Chicagoans and already frequent the Windy City Beef and Hot Dogs on Lake Mead. We really need the pizza now!!!!

Great food and friendly service. I always get the number 4 it's a Chicago dog and hot beef sandwich combo n comes with fries. Can't beat it for $8.50. I get both loaded and the sandwich wet. Amazing. Happy I live so close to this place.
Do not come to this place.!!! It's cheap for a reason. Thank goodness for the Cannoli which is worth the 2 stars

We've been here once before and it was ok. Decided to try it again for a pickup order and couldn't get past the rude lady on the phone. Some of the worst customer service I've ever had and I didn't even finish my order. Treat me like dirt and you won't get my business. Called the next day to speak to the owner/manager and the same rude lady said he couldn't talk. She was just as rude during this 2nd call. Sad thing is that I think this is a family run business and with such horrendous customer service, They may not be in business much longer.

When walking in you place your order at a counter before sitting down & fill your own pop/tea at a fountain machine. The woman who took our order was polite & went above  and beyond in service. We ordered Italian beef, a Chicago dog combo with a small beef, & a half baked pizza to go. We had to sit outside because our dog was with.  The patio area is covered & shared by the other businesses around. Shortly after sitting down the woman who took our order brought everything out to us and even gave us a free hot dog cut into little pieces for our dog. Very nice!

The beef and hot dog were great. Just like in Chicago. The thin pizza we got to finish cooking later didn't appear to be half baked but it still heated up fine without burning. Neither my husband or I liked the pizza very much. The crust was nice and thin ( which is hard to come by in Vegas) but it was very greasy and the sauce wasn't very good. I wouldn't get it again. Might go back and try a deep dish slice to see if it's any better.
Best wings in town, laid back atmosphere family friendly and quick service. Pizza is pretty delicious too!!

Not the same as Chicago style 
When asked question and said that's how it's made in Chicago. Was rudely told this is how the owner likes it and how we sell it 
They have their own flare 
Staff is not so friendly 
Pricey 
Not sure if we will return 
Order items ahead of time 
We waited a long time for hot dogs!!
God why can't we have a Portillo's here??

Cool little place to eat. The Italian beef was really good and tasted just like some of my favorite places in Chicago. They didn't have cheese sauce for the fries, which is always a must when in Chicago. The deep dish pizza tasted great, but the I prefer the toppings to be placed first, then cheese, and then sauce. Will definitely be back.

My only complaint is how far we have to drive to get there.  But, trust me .... it's WORTH the drive!!  Hands down, this is the BEST PIZZA IN VEGAS!!  
I first learned about this spot when I visited with a local foodie group.  It was SO worth it.  I have returned several times, and it is CONSISTENTLY GREAT.  I have had the pizza and the Italian Beef Sandwich.  The sandwich was really good, but the pizza is the star.  Their sauce is delicious, and the thin, crispy crust is excellent.  
The service is WAY better than I had expected from a small pizza place.  They treat the customers the way one would expect in a fine dining establishment.  They have a nice, front patio area, complete with a giant fountain.
I cannot say enough about WCB&P.  I will return every time I want a great pizza, or want to impress friends from out of town.
I LOVE THIS PLACE!!
-Joe

Love this place, and I've turned my coworkers on to it! I have yet to have anything I didn't like. The pizzas puffs are absolute amazing!! They are always friendly, food is always made to order, and they always have a special. They normally always have a deal on Groupon as well.
Short and quick: I love this place! Awesome wings (best wings), great pizza, and my husband loves the chili dogs. Staff is always friendly.

I ordered a 16" pepperoni deep dish Chicago pizza and there's no cheese what so ever. Only sauce. When I ordered the lady ask if I only wanted pepperoni no other topping and I told her yes. I figure that my pizza should have cheese even if I didn't ask for it. The pizza isn't that good either. I was hoping that this joint would be good but I guess I tired. I will just have to wait to go to Chicago for Chicago style pizza one of these days.

I stick to pieology next time in Downtown Summerlin.

Great pizza will have to try the hotdogs next time.
Fun decor and out do misters.
Waiters was very friendly.
A few other pokemon go characters.

Sometimes they have specials like dollar beers.

Woooaaahh talk about good pizza ! I went to chicago for the first time this year and got to taste there deep dish pizza and nothing like I've tasted in Vegas until now .Very good pizza and wings , family friendly place they have tvs with games going on. Staff was friendly only thing that kind of sucked was that we forgot the bears played today so the place was pretty much reserved so they didn't have tables inside for us to eat but since we took the long drive we decided to eat it outside but they take the food out to you. Well have to be back to try the hotdogs , thanks again!

After reading a positive review in Local Paper, was excited to try their Chicago Dogs. Have had great experiences with this item in Chicago & in Ft Lauderdale. Terrible, dog was room temperature, all the the condiments ,ice cod, and a squishy bun, two tastes and left, they refused to give a refund. BEWARE stay away.
Loved their Italian beef sandwich with sweet peppers, cheese, served wet. The employees are very nice, also liked the atmosphere to talk and enjoy lunch with friends.

Blonde girl and old lady with the long black hair are completely rude. 

Growing up in Chicago, we are nice, personable, approachable and polite. Unfortunately these cashiers are rude, have the worst attitude, and love to roll their eyes. Not to mention turn away their customers. 

First visit, blonde girl rolled her eyes various times during check out. She was not presentable and had the worst attitude. 

Tonight, we went in a 8:55pm. Being the second time, we were willing to try this place out because we were craving Chicago style food. Unfortunately, the cashier with the long black hair told us "we are closed, I forgot to turn off the sign." However.. it wasn't even 9pm yet. 

SO RUDE. WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE. I'M SURE THESE WOMEN ARE NOT FROM CHICAGO. Food was mediocre the first visit, but definitely not worth it with the sassy rude cashiers. 

Don't waste your time. GO TO BRANDO'S!! =)

After visiting Chi-town a couple years ago, I was suprised to see a large number of take out joints and carryout's advertising an item known as an "italian beef". Upon further investigation by way of the Food Network and Google, I found out that this is the Chicago state dish along with the Chicago style pizza. While I never had the opportunity to try this item in Chicago, I was pleasantly surprised that a Chicago style eatery had opened near my house.

#13 Windy City Combo - A Chicago style Italian Beef and Sausage Sandwich
Ordered this because I wanted to try an italian beef, but also wanted to try it with an Italian Sausage. Also wanted it "extra wet" to give it that authentic experience. The roast beef was extremely tender and flavorful with hints of garlic and spices. The italian sausage was flavorful with a little kick to it as well. And the roll was juicy due to the sandwich being dunked in a beef broth. All in all, it was a great sandwich.

I will be back to try the Chicago style Pizza, great experience here!

Love love love the food and service here!  I always get the #5 spicy sausage with everything, food is made to order and fries are always hot & fresh. I haven't tried the pizza yet and always say "next time" but I love hot dogs and just can't resist =)
Great prices too!

I really liked their deep dish pizza, though it is a bit expensive it is worth it. My only complaint is there wasn't enough cheese on the pizza and too much sauce. They could be a little bit friendlier at the front desk but whatever. I was reading some comments about them being rude but I just assumed they were more straightforward in Chicago. The lady doesn't give off a friendly vibe but a business vibe, and that's fine.  I love the breading/crust!  It is very thick. It reminds me of Papa Johns breadsticks which I love. The thick crust that is. I haven't tried the thin crust so I can't make comment on that. The thin crust is significantly cheaper, I believe it was like $11 for a small $18 for a small but it is enough for 3 people. Anyways, try the deep dish pizza it is good. The only other "Chicago" pizza I've tried is East of Chicago pizza which is actually one of my favorites. Chicago is pretty good with the pizza.
Also which was kind of cool, they have a white board in the front with a name on it, and if its your name they give you a free hotdog. Just a nice thing to do I suppose. Also a good place to watch sports and they have several tvs and a projector which is located in the front.

Ordered 2 # 2's 2 hot dogs with mustard,onion,green relish,pickle spear,tomatoes,peppers but told them one 1 order all I wanted on dog was mustard, relish and sauerkraut and they had nerve to charge me extra for the sauerkraut. WTF, got less, charged more.  Then they screwed up order and my well done fries were soggy when I got home due to waiting for them to fix order. BTW, dogs had no taste. Will stick to their pizza which is delicious

Being from the midwest Illinos at that you miss the chi pizza's and chi dogs,this place will make you remember why you love deep dish pizza and chicago dogs! There are many places that say they are chi style and are just merly imitating but not at the qualtiy of what chi style pizza and dogs are! This place seems like someone just picked it up from chicago and planted them where thery are here in vegas! The customer service is great they are friendly and they have 3 groupon offers to pick from i have bought all three nore than once, their hot wings are amazing as well! They have a thing where each day if your name is the one that's posted you get a free hotdog, i know mine will never be posted but i am okay with that...lol! They have dine in or take out, and they even have an option where you can but all the authentic stuff to make your own chi dog at home. The prices are reasonable and the quality is great. The portions are good and you feel welcomed when you are in there.
Italian Beef would challenge Portillo's, deep dish pizza was awesome. Momma thinks its the best she's ever had.

Place has the bomb dogs!! I got 2 classic hot dogs and they were soo good I wished I had got 4 of them! It came with a side of fries which were very tasty, they were perfectly crispy and topped with a season salt. I need to come back soon and try some other menu items!

OMG.  There Pizza is amazing.   I am from NY. And I love my New York style pizza.   But I also love Chicago deep dish.  Windy City deep dish is out of this world.  I don't due many reviews, but I had to for these guys.   I hope they get pizza at there Lake Mead location.  GO EAT THERE!!!!

So good! We ordered pep deep dish which was really good. The crust was not too hard, super cheesy. Not a lot of sauce so if you like sauce order extra! They finish it with some garlic butter I think perfect! We also ordered a chili cheese tamale was not expecting how delish is was! So moist and the chili is amazing! Def going back!
The price is reasonable and deep dish pizza is by far the BESt pizza we ever tasted. People are so friendly and fast service.  LoVe this Place. Definitely recommend this to my friends and family.

Super impressed. My new favorite lunch spot. I had the wings and fries with mango habanero sauce. They gave 12 wings. They were super fresh and perfectly crispy on the outside and still moist. Loved it!

My friends kept telling about this place. I finally went for my first visit and ordered the beef dipped sandwich which was highly recommended. I was not as impressed because the meat tasted gamey and it smelled like old meat. In retrospect, I should have added cheese and other fix'ins. But I don't think you should have to add sides to make the main dish taste better. Oh well, next time. Overall it was decent. Oh BTW: the fries were yummy. I asked for well-done and they obliged. I will probably go again and give it another chance and update this review.
Being from Chicago, I know a real Beef and Polish when I taste it. If you like authentic Chicago food and sports vibe, dis is da place!

4 stars only because there is a charge to get a splash of giardiniera for my Italian Beef Sandwich. The sandwich was tasty, the beef was good, the bread was almost on par with Chicago Italian bread I got when I was a kid. The search for the "right" Italian Beef Sandwich is long and hard. This find was close. Very close. 

The staff is very friendly. While it was a damp night outside, it was comfy inside. I always have a high expectation for an IBS, and they would be very high on my list of "must go." I probably could have eaten a larger sandwich, but I left satisfied. More recent reports (my Chicago cousins stopped in) are that the quality is still on the high side. I might need to make a stop next time I'm in Vegas to see if it's still on par.
Had the thin crist pizza. Was not impressed with the sauce. Not up to Chicago standards in my opinion. May be a little overrated.

I've come to love the hot dog that's smothered with their hot dog chili, so much so that the staff working here is telling the line cooks in the back my order as soon as I walk in the door! That's Nina for you!! I don't come here too often, but the employees here greet not only me by first name, but all their regular customers that come in. Very cool and bumped up a star for it.  

Anyways like their hot dogs, the chili w/no beans are Vienna Beef brand. Authentic Chicago. I like that the chili sauce is not too spicy and not too thick or runny either.  The #3 also comes with fries in a separate paper bag. They also have pizza at this location..I still have yet to try. One of these days I'll try that corned beef rueben sandwich too!

Most menu items are under $10 for hot dogs and sandwiches. Pretty reasonable. They also still print out a monthly calendar with the daily specials, Or check out the chalkboard in front of register for specials of the day.
I love this place. It definitely has the Chicago flavor. Anytime I feel like a taste of home I go here. If you call for pickup the service is fast and still hot! There is also patio seating.

Amazing restaurant, so happy we found this gem about a year ago! The deep dish sausage pizza is our favorite, full of flavor and amazing dough for the pizza crust. The #5 is our go to for a quick bite, always delicious! The best part about this place is the staff and environment. Everyone is always nice friendly and helpful, and there's even a place to enjoy your food outside on a cute patio area! All around best Chicago food by far!
This is the best beef dip in town.  I cannot recommend this place highly enough.  Always good service.

This was my first time trying out some Chicago eats, and let me tell you, it did not dissapoint. We decided to order the Chicago style deep dish pizza, I had never had deep dish pizza before, but I didn't see what the big deal was - it's a pizza with a but more dough. This was my pre- first bite opinion, and I was so very, very wrong. The pizza came, all hot and with the sauce on top- I was weirded out for sure, but then I took a bite and it changed my life forever. Not even kidding, I was still eating the thing even when I was full. Not only was this pizza the best deep dish Chicago style pizza I have ever had, but it is THE best pizza I have ever  had. It was a great foodie moment, but then the realization hit me - I live thousands and thousands of miles away from here and in a different county to boot! All I have to say is if you are in Vegas, try this pizza, it will forever change your life. If I am ever back in Vegas, this is the first and last place I want to stop in to grab me a slice of pizza pie heaven! The place sort of looks like your unsuspecting average pizza joint, but don't be fooled, amazing pizza lives here!

All the worlds a critic when it comes to pizza, so here is mine. We had the the thin crust, large. I don't recall the name of it but it had about 4 or 5 initials, basically a combo. Overall, we thought it was Ok, not bad by any mean, and not a standout either. But what that means also is it the pizza we will go back to? No, it is not. The crust was thin, but overcooked, which happens. But it not really have that flavor that a well rested yeast will impart. The cheese as well didn't quite seem right. Not sure why but just did not like the flavor of it. I am anxious to try their dofs sometime though, but my pizza search continues.

Great local joint for those who love Chicago everything. They had a great Saturday deal with a large pizza and wings. The pizza was delicious and filling. It also came out fairly fast for a deep dish pizza. My husband also got a Chicago style hotdog just to try it and it was really good. The staff also was friendly. We will be going back to this place!
Best pizza in town!! I loved the deep dish pizza and cannolis! Also they give out free hot dogs to people with specific names on certain days :-) if you go, I hope it's the day for your name!

I found my new favorite pizza place in Vegas!  I'm a self proclaimed pizza snob and much to the ire of friends and family am usually not overly impressed with most others call great pizza.  That all changed this afternoon.  I'm not a fan of thin crust so a good deep dish is the way to my heart.  I've had Chicago pizza in Chicago and it's always been meh.  I came in for a single slice of the sausage deep dish but was informed that they were all sold out for the day.  They usually stop serving single slices around 4pm but in my case they sold out early (it was 3pm).  Decided to order a 12 inch sausage supreme to go.  It takes 30 min to bake but it's well worth it.  The crust was perfectly baked, light and flavorful.  The pizza was several inches deep and was loaded with onions, green peppers, mushroom, and of course big chunks of Italian sausage.  The sauce is rich and slightly sweet and has chunks of tomatoes in it.  Windy City has dine in or carryout options.  There is also outside seating.  They have an extensive menu of all foods Chicago.

Just like home! Real Chicago food! Hotdog beef sausage yep they have it all! The eastern location has pizza too

I you need a fix of Chicago's best, Wind City Beef and Pizza has my vote! 

Real Chicago native run! They understand the urge

This place is GREAT for Chicago style pizzas. I did their carry-out deep dish and I couldn't have been more pleased. I also their Chicago style hotdog, they use Vienna Beef which I like the most but overall the hotdog was so-so. However, where their hotdog lacked, the pizza made up for it and more. It was nice and thick with long amazing stretching cheese with each bite. The crust was cooked perfectly and complemented the pizza perfectly. I am able to usually eat 3 or 4 slices of pizza, but I was only able to take down 2 slices of Windy City's because it was loaded nicely. This place is definitely a new go to for pizza for me and gets a solid 5 star rating for their pizza.

I first came here because I had a groupon. It came with 2 small "salads" ("" because it was pretty much iceberg lettuce and a side dressing), a deep dish, and 2 cannolis. It was a pretty good deal. For the pizza, we got sausage and mushroom. It was very tasty and filling. I could only eat one slice! Customer service was ok. The older white lady was very short with me. I'm not to sure if it was because i had a groupon or not. Anyways, we'll be back to try other food here.

I reviewed this establishment 2 years ago, and I'm delighted to say they have improved the menu flavors from what I had considered  to be 4 star to now a 5 star!  They minimized or eliminated the spicy black pepper amount that was in the Italian beef back at that time and they took out the sweetness in their pizza sauce making it more like we have in Chicago.  Their hot dogs by far are the best in Las Vegas and this is supported by being VOTED #1 in the recently published LV REVIEW JOURNAL 2015 "BEST OF LAS VEGAS" SURVEY.  CONGRATULATIONS WC... you earned it!   Also, one of my favorites is the Italian beef and sausage combo.... It's delicious!   Finally,  try the cheeseburger and gyros....I know you will be impressed.
Deep dish loaded was fantastic. 12 inch was very filling and tasty. Highly recommend.

OK, I'll start with a tip. If you are a Dodger fan, don't show up at Windy City Pizza during a Cubs playoff game and expect to feel welcome. The place was packed with avid Cubs fans and about 5 TVs playing the game. The good news for me - the Cubs were in the process of beating the Giants, so I had no conflict.
I shared a small deep dish pizza with my wife. Unequivocally, the best pizza I have had in Vegas. High quality cheese and delish crust. Two slices and I was stuffed. We got to bring home half the pie for dinner the next night (yes, it re-heats really well).
If you are fan of Chicago style deep dish pizza (or you are a fan of the Chicago Cubs!) and are looking for an inexpensive, informal meal, this is the place to go.

Best Chicago cuisine in the state! The people are awesome so that's a bonus.

Being a true Chicago Chick, I had my doubts. I'm not one of "those" people who say I'm from Chicago and I grew up in Joliet..Lol

So, trust me when I say, best beefs and pizza. 

And don't expect ketchup on your hot dog either pally....not here!

The Italian beef was good but the pizza wasn't a deep dish. It was more like a pan pizza you can get at pizza hut. So if your looking to get a chicago style deep dish you will be a little disappointed.

My 11 y.o. son and I ate lunch here today for the first time. He ordered the Chicago dog with everything on it. The nice lady taking our ordered informed us there was hot peppers on it and it might be too spicy. We agreed to leave the peppers off. When we were almost done, she noticed my son was upset and brought him a plane hot dog, no questions asked.  When I got my Diet Coke refill I told her thank you and she was concerned he didn't like it and that is why she brought the plane dog. I explained to her he was upset about something else. I have not been anywhere else in Vegas where an employee had as much compassion and constant observation to make sure we enjoyed our meal. We will definitely be back and appreciate the kindness!!
Came here for the Bears game since my dad is from Chicago. He enjoyed the food and the atmosphere.

If I could give 1000000 stars I would. You CANNOT find a better Italian beef sandwich anywhere else! THE BEST ITALIAN BEEF SANDWICH IN LAS VEGAS! The thin crust pizza is to die for! The sauce has the perfect amount of sweetness! Their friend fries taste just like McDonald's! The people are always amazing! Honestly I can't say enough great thing about this place.
I am thrilled to say the Italian beef is yummy to this gal's tummy! Great sammy, the Polish is fantastic.

Normally I would only eat hotdogs at a BBQ and only if there was nothing else to eat. I HATE hotdogs. But my husband was craving them and I refused to cook some up for him. So we ended up here. 

I'm so glad we did. I went a head and ordered a chili cheese dog and fries. I love chili. I was pleasantly surprised about how good the whole dog was! I ate it all. The fries are seasoned and tasted great too. 

They had the football game on when we entered. Another bonus!

Amazing place to eat food always fresh made to order, there's nothing on the menu you won't find it doesn't taste good service is always great to move the guy that runs the place is super cool everything always taste great service if you're from Chicago or the  Midwest will definitely appreciate the culture and vibe of this place. Price is medium range. 
My favorites 
Pizza Puff 
Italian Beef 
Jumbo Chicago Dog 
Deep dish pizza.
Overall 8/10 on every aspect.

I have finally changed my idea of the perfect pizza, I'm now hooked on deep dish! The 30 minute  wait was WELL worth it. Between me and my husband we were barely able to finish half the pizza. We also had cannolis and they are by far the best i've had, so crispy and just perfect. This has become a favorite!

Used a Group On coupon that was accepted with no problem.  The salad was basic but the lettuce was very fresh and crisp.  Choice of dressings - extremely limited.  Pizza was good if you've never had deep dish in Chicago.  If you have - it was meh.  The crust was good.  Sausage was sparse, onions over abundant. Compared to Las Vegas pizza it was better than most.  The cannolis were good.  I may have been over-charged a few bucks, but didn't quibble.  Service was excellent and folks very nice.  Plastic utensils are a big non-starter.  Atmosphere - basic deli.  Disclosure - I've lived in Chicago and worked at Giordano's so my review might be a bit critical.
No need to search further.  Real Chicago Deep Dish Pizza.  Great decor and Chicago sports memorabilia,  even though I'm originally from rival St. Louis.  Friendly staff and reasonable prices.

Ok I said I would give them another try..I'm glad I did. I bought a gyro and I enjoyed it. I was thoroughly impressed. The only draw back was the gyro sauce. The cucumber pieces were cut too big and it was missing some key flavors but all in all it wasn't bad. There are some other things I will go back & try.

I've been wanting to try this place for the longest time. I lived in Chicago for a few years so I was really craving some deep dish. I call to place my order and a female employee answers. Right from the start she spoke to me in a condescending tone and even made fun of me. After her doing that a couple times i asked her if that was how she treated customers, cussed her out, and hung up on her. No way I'm getting treated like I'm stupid when I'm trying to give you my money.

Great place to grab some chicago bites. Having tried the italian beef, chili dog, and deep dish pizza here i have enjoyed all 3 so far. Also makes a good lunch spot as they have deep dish by the slice and a selection of hotdog and beef sandwhich combos.

We love this place! Always friendly service, great food, and a place to hang with family. They usually always have affordable specials (especially $2 beers with Knights games and when any Chicago team is playing.

We had a large order from them for Superbowl, and they forgot one of our pizza's and had somebody drop it off! Even offered a 50% discount on my next order. That is how you do customer service! Pizza is very tasty! The wings were so good! I am a wings girl, and they were BOMB! TRY if you are in the area!

This a cute place with friendly staff and good eats!

Tucked away in a little strip mall section in the larger Target strip mall, this all-Chicago themed restaurant serves up pizza (thin and deep dish), hot dogs, wings, desserts, and other items. They also have a food challenge and lots of specials and deals.

You can eat in, take out, or get delivery. You order at the counter, but they will bring the food to your table.

The walls are lined with Chicago memorabilia.

The hot dogs are yummy, the pizza is good, and the wings are decent. It's not the best pizza I've ever had, but it's solid and I like the deep dish. The wings are small, but a good quality that is cooked well. Skip the side salad - not even slightly worth the money. The cannoli is a good ending to your meal.

All in all, I'll be back a lot.

The deep dish cheese pizza is to die for!! It is the perfect amount of cheese, sauce, dough. They also had a special of one slice of cheese pizza and pop for $5-- can't beat that! This was my first time there but I will now be a returning customer.
Both types of pizza (thin & Chicago style pan) are awesome. They have Chicago dogs too but I'm a pizza man.  They watch all Chicago sports teams there.

Windy City Beefs and pizza just does not disappoint. As our Cubs are headed into the playoffs owners Tim and Dakota have added Chicago Stockyards slider platter!! it is so delicious! thanks guys for everything you do for us former chicagoansinthedesert to make us feel at home in the desert. From the authentic Vienna hot dogs to the Chicago decorated theme I always feel at home when I'm here #former #chicagoans #inthedesert #shopchicagoan #hirechicagoan

Love the Chicago Italian Beef Sandwich here! The spicy giardiniera topping for this 'messy' sandwich soaked in au jus. They provide big rolls of paper towel that's so needed. 
Service was very friendly each time we visited. Pizza was good as well.

Sweet Chicago pizza
We had thick and thin, either way you can't go wrong. 8 slices for the deep dish.
It had mildly sweet sauce and canned tomatoes, good portion of cheese and the crust isn't too thick!
Good Chicago Food !! Good Chicago service!!! Enjoy it every time we go!! Love the gyro, hotdogs and beef sandwich!! Can see a good Chicago game too !!

Really enjoy eating here at lunch with my co-workers. We are always treated great by the folks that work here, and the food has never let us down. I have had the pizza, hot dogs, gyro, and chili fries, all are great but I always go back to the greatest sandwich at this place, the good ole number 13 combo, Italian beef and sausage combo, wet with cheese. Everything about this sandwich is great, from the flavor of the Italian beef and sausage, to the fluffiness and magic of the bread. Only complaint is the decor, way to much Bears crap on the walls, gives me a head ache, SKOL VIKINGS!!! Haha

OMG this place is the best for Chicago food. And if you are looking for a place to watch Chicago sports on Vegas you have to come here ngrb bite to eat too. Tim is awesome! It's got great Chicago decor and hot dogs, beef and pizza just like home. Of course they have beer too. Stop in sometime and get a beef sandwich- you won't be disappointed.

This is our favorite Chicago food joint. Been going for a couple years now ....you walk in the door and you think your back home. The staff and owner are awesome and the food is authentic. I can't say anything negative about Windy City. We've had just about everything on the menu and have never had a bad experience. During football season Bears fans come together and have the best time. If you haven't been there you need to make it a point to go soon...you won't be disappointed.

This place is the bomb.  I love their pizza both thin and deep dish.  Their wings are also incredible.  Heck, all of their food is really good.  I don't think I have had a bad piece of food here.  The walls are adorned with everything Chicago and this is definitely the place to go to watch an Illinois team game while chowing down on awesome food.  

They have a special on Saturdays which is any large thin or deep dish pizza with three toppings, 2 drinks, and wings for only $27.  Really a steal when you consider how much food it is.

Try this place.

I live about an hour and a half to 2 hours drive west over a large mountain from here depending on traffic.

I mentioned this to the Woman, who took my order that I was all the way from Pahrump and how much I was really looking forward to having some freshly made Chicago style pizza in a very long time. 

The Frozen Deep Dish pizzas from Chicago chains that you can order online for home delivery just aren't that great in my opinion.

I ordered their large Deep Dish and the large thin crust square cut style to go and a bottle of hot Gardinera and then I left to go move my car...I had parked in a bad spot because the parking area was jam packed.

When I came back to pick up my pizzas... the lady at the counter acted oddly, even nervous in fact I thought at the time maybe It was my appearance. She told me she gave me the discount for some current coupon they were accepting that day.

I was all that's great and thank you very much...the 2 pizzas still came to just under $50 dollars in total... but I thought wow! How considerate of her.

When I got back home I was really excited about having some authentic Chicago style food....you just can't get that in this small town I poured a glass of cold beer to celebrate my extra effort of driving all that way.

The verdict:  a God Awful disappointment!!! the deep dish pizza crust was burnt so badly it left a appallingly bitter taste in my mouth a flavor that permeated the whole pizza...The thin crust as well was way over cooked...both ended up in the trash can.

I think I can see why the lady working there was so nervous and gave me a slight discount....very bad form on her part if it was done on purpose.

I wish when they realized they were badly burnt she had offered to make 2 new pizzas and just apologize for the extra wait.

However it's possible it was just a mistake, maybe she didn't know the crust was burnt since the top of the Deep Dish pizza looked great but that shows a lack of quality control at least on this occasion.

To be fair this occurred months ago and I've only been there once and maybe the food and service is normally great and accidents can happen with food.

Great Chicago food. The beef are out of this world with the hot peppers. Had a dog with the works today.  The only thing they could improve on is the fries. Today they were soggy, but last time they were just right. Going to try the 50 cent wings next Tuesday .

Yet another Chicago transplant who stumbled upon this place... Walking inside I couldn't keep the grin off my face as it really resembled a Chicago hole in the wall. In a good way! (Place was actually very clean and organized. Perhaps they should spill some beer on the floor to get that authentic Windy City sticky feel) ordered the Chicago dogs to be safe and they hit the nail on the head! Next up chili dog, but I may have to draw the line with the deep dish... MAYBE...

Best Chilli dog ever, and yes I had them put extra extra Onions. It was delicious.  Foot long hot dog with chilli & Onions , came with a side of fries. Good atmosphere.  Big screen with other flat screens mounted around dinning room.  I been here before but not on weekends. Just wanted a snack while out running errands- Wanted a slice of pizza , but you can only get sliced on week days, Chilli dog made up for everything. This a Chicago hang out, but Cowboys always welcomed......
Best canolis in town! Great friendly environment for lunch. The staff is really friendly and welcoming. They made us feel like they were happy to have us eat here.

I've been to their other location on Lake Mead for hot dogs and beefs but when I heard that this one had deep dish pizza I just had to check it out. I love deep dish pizza and have been unable to find any places in Vegas that compare to the ones I've had in Chicago. Long story short, the pizza here is deceiving and should in no way be called deep dish. It is simply a normal pizza with thicker, flakier crust! The good news is that the pizzas and cannolis are made fresh because it took a while for each item to be made and brought to my table. The cannolis were ok...I've definitely had much better ones elsewhere. I guess my search for authentic Chicago style deep dish pizza continues...

Opted for the wings cuz I have a strong craving. Never tried them here before but SO glad I did! Tried two sauces: hot and Chicago hot. I personally like the hot better, it's traditional whiffle the other is very heavy on garlic. Bomb. I will be back.
Great pizza, the deep dish is awesome! Love all the Bulls decor. They also sell 312 beer. Kids loved the hot dogs

Pricey but just ok. Person behind the counter was very nice. 
Fries were served in a brown bag, cute! 
Deep dish pizza was ok, nothing spectacular. 
Huge tv though so if you want to catch a game, probably get there early enough to get a seat.
Chicago in Vegas. BEST Chicago beef I've had, GREAT pizza and wonderful dogs.  Just GO!

Great hot dogs, pizza is ok I'm used to new york style pizza because that's where I'm from so it was very different for me.  But pretty good,  They are a bit pricy but there aren't to many places like this around.  It has a certain back east feel to the place.
Definitely have to try atleast once.

I'm Italian born and raised in the heart of Chicago and since we moved to Las Vegas 8 years ago... Windy City is by far #1 on my list for authentic Chicago-Style pizza, beef and Vienna hot dogs!!! The atmosphere alone makes me quite homesick...

I ordered the wings and fries and the pizza I've had better why do people use Chicago for a selling point in Vegas I don't understand it go back home this is the west coast.....and the wings are basic nothing fancy how can they be Chicago wings when my wife make Better wings then this place pathetic and the lady who takes your order I mean damn go get some teeth every body looking at me weird cause I have a red wings hat on I don't like this place had better food other places don't waster your food or gas cause I live 30 mins away and drove here...I mean the cashiers voice is so loud I can here her voice across the room Jesus lady quiet it down your friend is right next to you not across the room
For those who know "Chicago Food" and especially "Chicago Style Pizza", this is the place to go..

I'll start with the bad then go on.  Mainly because there isn't too much bad.
The girl working isn't very friendly.  Instead of a Chicago style pizza place she should work at a NY style pizza place.  
Anyways, we move on.  I wanted to try out a Chicago style pizza place since it's been a long time.  It was A-OK in my book.  They do a nice job with the pizza.
We used a groupon so we got a good deal. Came with two salads large pizza and two cannoli's.  We didn't realize how big that pizza was.  We were lucky to be able to take it back to the hotel b/c we had a refrigerator.  Otherwise way too much food for two people.  Could easily fead four or five people.  We didn't even take the cannoli's b/c we had too much food.  Also - I've never eaten them so I didn't want to waste the food in case I didn't like them.
The place is simple but there is Chicago memorabilia everywhere.  If you're a packer or redwing fan you may not like it.  - j/k - place is pretty cool.

Portillos..Who? Best place for Chicago dogs. As a Chicago native for over 20 years then moving to Vegas, this was a wonderful find. Tina always remembers your name. Everyday, they give free items away, if your name happens to be the name on the board. I literally go there once a week for my hot dog and side salad fix. Just waiting for the day, my name is on the board....Tim, wink, wink :)

Located in the Silverado Ranch Plaza at Silverado Ranch and Eastern.  Look for Office Depot and Yummy Grill. Love the sports memorabilia all over the walls, the Cubs, the White Sox, the Bears, the Bulls, the Black Hawks, pictures of the great landmarks of Chicago. There are a few binders filled with old memories from Chicago for you to look through but I think there were all just black and white printing from online. 

I love deep dish pizza so instant 4 star.  I've already gone to Chicago and ate the good stuff a number of times but I'm far from any expert on the stuff.  A New Yorker might say MEH cause it's not NY pizza.  A Chicagoan might say MEH cause it's not as good as back home.  Honestly I'd say we're not in Chicago or New York we're in Vegas/Henderson :) Don't be offended everyone I haven't read anyone reviews but heard how some think when it comes to pizza.  I enjoyed it enough to go once on Friday that a few days later on a Monday.  It's not a fancy pizzeria that you dress up for and pay high prices.  It is just a good pizza, really the ingredients to make a pizza are literally 1/4 of the price everyone else charges for. Their deep dish is plenty filling like how a deep dish should be.  Thick, gooey, and made to be eaten with a knife and fork or hands if I was at home.  The sauce was a little too sweet for me and I would've loved to have a more buttery crust but all in all cooked properly together with some good ingredients it made a very satisfying pizza. Lots of cheese, meat, and sauce in a deep dish crust you can never go wrong.

They also made a thin crust which also wasn't that bad. They were cut into squares and about the thickness of a "regular" pizza. Not very thin and extra crispy like other thin crusts I've had.  Their pizzas are good especially when you get them on day where they're selling it at buy one get one free, check their calendar for daily specials.  If you don't really know what kind of pizza to order just order their WCBNP Pizza thin crust or deep dish it's a mixture of various ingredients or just keep it simple with cheese, meat, and sauce in a deep dish.

M-F during lunch they serve deep dish by the slice for $4. The slice is almost a quarter in size of the whole thing. With these try to get here early when their fresh out the oven cause it does sit and they when they warm it up it the crust might get hard.  

There have 2 hotdog for $1 and often offer free Chicago dog to anyone named whatever random name they put up on the board. There's multiple large flat screen TVs throughout the restaurant for watching sports. Cheese cake on a stick. There's lots of space inside. If you want to sit outside in the shared patio with other business at night they'll setup some light to see. Good service and reasonably priced.

Been twice and I'll go back again. Why?

First off the customer service. They are actually nice here. I used to put up with another pizza place in the area; that place had hung up on me and are impatient. None of that here.

Thin crust is cut into squares. The middle pieces are hard to eat. Maybe get cutlery. Make sure you have tons of napkins and cover your clothes. Loads of delicious oil drips off. 

Meat special is loaded with pepperoni, sausage, bacon and ground meat. The pepperoni is so good. It actually tastes so good you try to find pieces with more of them. The ground meat contrasts with a barely seasoned taste, just meaty. I don't remember running into much bacon, but this pizza was good. 

Chicago Style Italian Sausage comes in mild and hot. I opted for mild and got it wet. The bread is soggy but dense enough to hold up. It's loaded with sweet peppers. You can also get a side of marinara which I not only put in my sandwich, but dipped my fries in. Good stuff! Like the pizza eating this sandwich was a messy experience, but tasty.

Grab a calendar. They have random deals, things like if your name starts with the letter "g" you get a discount. They are active on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/WindyCityBeefsnpizza?fref=ts

There's plenty of seating and a television to keep you busy while you wait. The bright yellow walls and the light covers might entertain you too.

If there were no stars to give that's what I would give. I've been in Henderson for about a little over a month now. Trying to get used to the food differences here had been difficult to say the least. Finally I came across what I hoped would be a piece of home. Born and raised in Chicago I thought, great let's see what this place is about. On moving day after a very long day of moving I ordered pizza, fries and wings. This place is only 3 miles from my home and this simple order took more than 2 hours to get to my home then of course was cold! Too tired and disgusted from what was a long day of moving. I wasn't in the mood to argue and decided I will never order from here again. Then the manager called on her own to apologize the next day and offer a discount on our next orders. I said wow! That's great! Thank you. That's a really nice gesture you're saying to yourself. Well yes i5 thought so too. Then! I decided today to place my second order ever here. A deep dish pizza, half sausage/half cheese and fries. They delivered the pizza and fries, remembered who I was and said sorry we disappointed you the first. Ok, no problem. I get everything ready for us to eat our deep dish that we've been waiting an hour for (typical for deep dish), open the box and its a THIN CRUST SMALL MUSHROOM PIZZA. What is wrong with these people! Am I being punked right now??? Now after complaining to them I have to wait for another pizza to arrive so AGAIN my pizza will take 2 hours to get here. I'm done. This is just ridiculous and the cashier had the AUDACITY to say they wouldn't charge me for ANOTHER pizza. REALLY!!

This has become my & my fiance's favorite place for some nearby grub! Great service, fair prices, and amazing Chicago style pizza, subs & dawgs. 

Everyone should at least try the pizza!!!!
Great Chicago style pizza. Their sauce is super tasty.
Awesome place my husband and I love it. Staff is really friendly and the food is great.

Quite simply the deep dish is not as good as the thin crust or Amores deep dish for that matter.  The crust was too chewy, a bit burnt, and not really buttery.  Way too much sauce for the pie and not enough cheese.  I still am a fan of the thin crust and will try more items here, but I would recommend skipping the deep dish.

Ok - let's start with the important stuff...

1. The Italian Beef is dope. I suggest getting it dipped, the bread holds an amazing amount of flavor that way.

2. Meat Trio Deep Dish - as good a deep dish as i have ever had outside of the actually city of chicago. I really liked it the couple times we've ordered one, only slight complaint was that the bacon was just a touch underdone, but the pie was still awesome.

3. Pizza Puffs - these are not panzerottis exactly, but they are pretty damn good.

I have yet to get with the vienna beef hotdogs here but i am sure they live up to all the other menu items.

The staff is always in a good mood and very nice.  Calling ahead to pick up orders is a breeze and they keep your info in their system so if you just wanna repeat what you had last time they already know what that was.

Highly recommend this place.  Good eats.
In town for a few days& the kids wanted pizza! They said the best they've ever had, I agree! Great service and food!

Kept it simple and went with a standard hotdog, fries, and half an Italian beef sandwich (the #4). Hotdog, got it right: steamed poppy seed bun, Vienna dog with right amount of snap to it, all the usual Chicago dog trimmings. Fries, hot and crispy, appear to be hand-cut, and if not, using a quality frozen. The Italian beef, meh: believe they are using the frozen Vienna product most places outside of Chicago use.

Overall, getting the job done. If you want an Italian beef, find a place that actually makes their own, like the beef places back in Chicago do.

Came in while visiting Vegas off of a Groupon deal...have to say it was the best pizza and cannoli my husband and I have had in ages! I know I will be wishing this place was closer to home!
