Great food, great people, great place to watch football game, just a great place that we look forward to coming back to...thank you Windy City Pizza!!!
An outstanding Chicago eatery and they make their own Italian beef. Three temperatures of giardiniera and all the fixings on the hot dogs without disgusting ketchup.  Lots of authenticity.
Had a great 16" polish here. Amazingly juicy

Great Chicago creations! Their hot dogs are awesome.. very flavorful! The best of both is the way to go! You get a hot dog and a 4inch beef sandwich. Their thin crust pizza is really good. Nice sauce and cut in squares. They play sports games on the TVs and have daily specials and text offers.

The pizza is meh and now Vegas has a Giordanos selling real Chicago style pizza. I had a polish here.. they claimed a Maxwell Street Polish.. It was a large hot dog. LMFAO.. This was the second time I tried this place. The first I had a hot dog. Met. Never again.
By far the best deep dish pizza in town. Even when u get delivery its piping hot and the cheese is stringy. Love this place

Rude lady at the register! Short black hair older woman rude as fuck. Wont be back here ever again. The establishment may want to consider finding someone else for that position otherwise they will lose customers left and right!

Idunno what the deal is with the one or two people who say this isn't Chicago style deep dish... this place is right on and they're friggin nuts. Sauce is spot on Giordano's and Lou's, clearly made with the same ingredients and love of Chicago deep dish heritage. So what it's not Uno's? Or Lou's? It's a delicious and unique take on home and I couldn't live here in this shit desert without it. 

As is custom with my fav, Giordano's, I always go big with sausage and onion and I must say, as someone who drives three hours to and from Portillo's once a month, the dogs are legit good. They'll hold you over. Maxwell street is delish, too...  so don't be a hater. If you love Chicago you can love this place too. The food is Blackhawk worthy. And cheaper than we're used to pizza-wise.

Just tried yesterday for the first time. Passed on the "non Pizza" Groupon which would have brought me in months ago. Finally caved in and took the family for a thin crust pizza. I was really happy with the ingredients and the overall tatse of the pie. 

 My picky 5 year old had to have the corn dog which was strange because I'm pretty sure he had never had one. It was a corn dog, nothing more, nothing less.  

I'll be back to try the beefs next week.

Just moved to Nevada from Illinois. Have had a few different pizza places and we just haven't had that great of a pizza until we came here! It was excellent almost tasted like we would get back home. Would  recommend to others so good! Can't wait to come back and try more from menu.

Not sure what some of the bad reviews are about but Ive lived in Vegas a little over a year and the customer service here has always been great. Food is always good and we will always be coming back. Being born and raised in Chicago my whole life the food here reminds me of the traditional "hotdog stand" back home.

I am no deep dish pizza connoisseur, but I know when it tastes good, and this place has some tasty deep dish pizza. We've come twice with Groupons and it is such a steal!! The salads are a miss with generic iceberg, tomatoes, and little else I remember with a choice of garlic or ranch dressing. It is more like ranch with a side of lettuce than vice versa since it is too thick to drizzle. Moving on, the pizza is the star of the show!! We ordered the deep dish with pepperoni, Italian sausage, mushrooms, and onion and boy do they pile it on! Every bite has plenty of toppings and a very crispy crust on the bottom. I don't even know how this is possible when so many NY style pizza places can't even manage to keep their crusts crispy with minimal toppings. I think this pizza may be the 8th world wonder. 

The cheese used is amazing. It stretches and stretches. I bet it could reach the length of the table. Last time we were here on a Tuesday, and they had 50 cent wings. The wings here are always plain and come with various sauces to dip. They are legitimate, crispy, fried to perfection wings. After our order of 8, I really contemplated getting another batch because they were great, but had to remind myself that we still had that beast of a pizza coming. Lastly, we finished off with some cannolis. Even though it looks like they're already prepared and sitting in a fridge, the shells remain crispy. This place should be called No Sog Pizzeria, because nothing here is soggy. Eveything is crispy and perfect, just the way it should be!
I was expecting more based on the reviews. It's a nice little hole in the wall. Prices are average but have to agree that customer service is pretty lousy.

If you're from River Grove just west of Chicago and like Gene & Jude's, then  you'll like the hot dogs here. And no ketchup ! They know way too many things about the right way to make a hot dog & you can tell they're from Chi Town. Great dogs  without the fear of getting mugged out  in the parking lot like back in the day down in Chicago on Maxwell street .

First of all I bought a Groupon before I even try this place out but the false advertising pizza picture of a real Chicago pizza got me. Got the one for $19 that was my first mistake I made thinking this place knew what a Chicago pizza even was. Well I was right putting sauce on top of a pan crust pizza is not a Chicago pizza look at your fake picture that a real pizza.  I guess they have never even been to Chicago or tried a real Chicago pizza before. I ate 2 slices could not even find or taste the topping on it had to put ranch and Sriracha just to get it down. The cheese was questionable not even sure if it was real cheese no stringiness to it. The pizza just taste like grease with a can of tomato sauce on top. The other 6 slices in about the only thing Chicago like was the pizza box are in my garage in the trash can and that is the first time I ever threw a pizza away in my life. The salads that came with it was a joke only iceberg lettuce and 2 not ripe thin slices of tomatoes and some expired onions plus the garlic mayo they call a dressing (disgusting) that normally they charge $4 for lol food cost is about $ .55 cents per salad. I understand markup but give me a break this place is a ripe off. As far as the 2 cannolis that came with it was store bought after one bite they went in the trash also. So that was a waste of $ 19 plus the $ 1.88 tax it would have been better spent at Walmart on frozen pizza , head of lettuce , tomato and a onion. Then I could have bought a real desert and still had dollars left over. The inside of the place is not even worth mentioning or the employees either because you should never have to go inside this dump. Just buy a frozen pizza you will enjoy it more and save money too.
Amazing deep dish pizza, Italian beef, and hot dogs! All fresh ingredients and great service, combined with a lovely outdoor patio.  I'm coming back with friends!

Yum, yum, yum!  I am from Chicago and this is the real deal. I love all of the Chicago memorabilia around this place. They always have specials going on as well. I haven't tried the pizza yet, but it sure looks good! The gyros are good, but not great. I prefer the gyros from a nearby Greek restaurant. But, their combo with sausage and beef, yum!  You can order in three ways from what I remember. If the bread isn't falling apart all over the place, you didn't order it the right way!  I love my bread dunked in the gravy, nice and messy and super tasty!  Employees are always super friendly, we will be back for sure!
Sorry, I desperately wanted to find a great Chicago pizza place in Vegas, and I was told that this was better than Lou Malnatis and Giordano's, but it's simply just not true. Still searching!

SO THIS IS WHAT YOU CHICAGOANS ARE USED TO!

I bookmarked this place because of all the check ins I see from my Yelp friends! If that many people just from my friends list go here, then it must be good! So the very first chance I got im all over it!

I asked the lady behind the counter what was good. She smiled and said everything. I asked what was good for a first timer. She said either the thin crust pizza or the Italian Beef or Sausage. So as my first ever order I went with the #13 Combo which was Italian Beef and Sausage on a roll which comes with fries and a drink. I also opted for the mozzarella cheese and sweet peppers. She asked if I wanted the sandwich dry, wet, or dipped. HUH? I guess I am a noob. Dry, the sandwich is just that. No sauce whatsover. Wet, they put a little bit of Au jus on the sandwich. Dipped, they literally dip the bottom half of the sandwich in Au jus. This sounded very intriguing so I picked that. 

When I got my sandwich, the bottom half of the bread was literally falling apart from the sogginess of the Au Jus. Like the noob I was, I still picked it up and tried to eat it like a regular sandwich. That's when I noticed the plastic fork that came with it. FAIL. Needless to say, it was really good. The Beef and Sausage put together was like Batman and Robin, Shaq and Kobe, Bobby Brown and Whitney Houston.......ok that last one was a bad example. Anyways, you know what I mean. The two meats mixed with melted mozzarella cheese and sweet peppers were fantasmic! (refer to my pic!) The fries were nothing to be excited about.

As I was scarfing down my meal, I noticed from the little cardboard cutout thingies that form a triangle (there were two of them) on the table. One had a picture of a Frozen Chocolate Dipped Cheesecake on a stick! The other said that tuesdays were 50 cent wing tuesdays. Just these two pieces of info alone should be more than enough to warrant another trip or three in the future!

I paid about around 10 bucks for my meal  which definitely filled me up. That was about the average price for any one of their combos. 

Since the theme and ambiance was based out of Chicago, of course everything you saw on the walls were nothing but things about the windy city! The overall size of the place was very spacious and the location is sort of tucked away in a nice sized plaza. 

I am definitely coming back to try the thin crust pizza and wings, especially on a tuesday! They have specials everyday. The day I went, the special was if your name was Dorothy or Ryan, you get a free hot dog! (with proof of your ID)

So in closing, this is another one of those places that you are glad you checked out for it will be on one of your good grub places to eat list! So yeah, I am definitely a fan!

Deep dish pizza was good. Perfectly seasoned and not too salty. Perfect crust! 

Chicago dog was served wrapped for in dining and way too small and expensive but has a great flavor. Cashier should've mentioned the special for 2 Chicago dogs, fries and soda for $7.50 instead of $5.00 one small Chicago dog. 

They could've used real utensils instead of plastic for in dining, especially for deep dish pizza!

This place has great food. Let me say that again, this place has great food. The problem with this place is the staff. I don't know if it's some kind of "Chicago thing" (which is completely BS, I've been to Chicago many times and nobody acts like this) but the lady working the counter couldn't have been more annoyed with everything we did. We asked to put tables together because we had a big group...eye roll. I changed my mind about the pizza topping before she ran the order in...eye roll and attitude. I didn't decide what beer I wanted within 4 seconds...more attitude. I could keep going. Maybe she was having a bad day or maybe it's this kind of made up Chicago attitude that she perceives as charming, but it's tired and dumb and I don't get why anyone wants to eat somewhere while "Flo" tells you to kiss her grits. I'll take my business somewhere else. If you're willing to deal with service like this then your a better person with me.

Really good pizza, lot of sauce and lots of cheese. Just the way I like my deep dish. There thin crust was not nearly as good. I have not tried the dogs yet, but I will get to them. They are a little pricey for a pizza place but nit over the top.

Giving two stars because the lady at the counter was a total sour puss. We got no welcome, no smile. We asked about pizzas and she was bitchy about that like how dare we ask about a slice....after lunch. When she brought our food to the table, she literally plopped it down and walked away. No "enjoy" no thank you...terrible service. You just served a chef and an event planner. Guess who I WILL NOT recommend? The hot dog was good and had a nice little snap and the roll was good. It could've used more green relish, in my opinion. I'd like to try a pie, but might not return because of the service. Everyone else got a hello, a thank you, a "what part of Chicago are you from?" We stood at the counter, looking at the menu and my associate was saying he'd like a dog but no fries, repeatedly. She never offered up the info that he could do that so I asked and she simply said, "3 and a quarter." Not, "sure, we can do that."  Not a nice thing about how she treated us. Not one. Terrible service.

Best Chicago food in Las Vegas!!  You must have the pizza, whether you like traditional deep dish or thin they have you covered.  They have Italian Beefs and homemade  Giardiniera and homemade cannoli. Great for any Chicago sports fan to watch a game!

I have several times walked by this establishment while visiting others nearby and always wondered about the food.  This time I thought I would give it a try.  I walked in and was greeted with a "hello" by the counter person.  I noticed one other customer I believe sitting at a table.  Looked clean and tidy nothing special, so I proceeded to order chicken wings mild which came with fries. My order was to go. The wings were soggy and flavorless and the mild sauce was given to me on the side in a little container.  The fries were in a bag and were greasy and soggy as well.  I really couldn't eat but two wings and I had to throw it away, it just was grossing me out.  I'm sorry but they need to step up to the plate literally and get their game on.  Your not the only wing, dog, pizza joint in town.

Went on a Saturday, first thing I noticed was adequate spacing and size of the restaurant. 

The girl at the counter was very cordial and definitely was on a mission to enhance the experience of eating there. 

I had the winds and the Deep Dish sausage pizza.  The pizza was very good,loved the toppings and being a crust fan,I definitely enjoyed that part. lol

The wings were EXCELLENT,I know the pizza is the star but those wings are addictive. Perfect texture,taste. I plan to be there sometimes for the .50 cent wing Tuesdays. I am instantly a fan. 

This place will do very well. I am confident.

Ordered delivery...the wait time was 45 minutes to an hour. The person taking my order seemed nice over the phone. The pizzas were huge and tasted absolutely amazing...this is a legit pizza place. I will be ordering from here again. The wings were well prepared and their chicago hot sauce for the wings are really good.

Stopped in here for the first time today. I'm a lover of hot dogs, sausages and pizza so I decided to give it a try. There was a woman working. Instead of looking at the entire menu which is pretty big I told her I wanted 2 hot dogs with onion and jalapeno. She said they didn't have jalapeno so I asked her what kind of toppings were available. She was very annoyed for some reason and was like relish, onion, etc etc,  and said THATS WHAT A CHICAGO DOG IS. OK I'm not from Chicago, I've never had a Chicago dog and that's not what i was asking. I also ordered 2 of the spicy sausages and again she gave me a condescending response and said polish or italian?? I work in service industry,  I completely understand that it can be annoying when people ask questions or seem stupid but this was not the case. Maybe she was just having a bad day. Anyhow the food was mediocre and with her horrible attitude I will not be back and I will surely tell others of my experience there

This was our first time dining at Windy City and they knocked it out of the ballpark. The Italian Beef made for a great app before a couple of pizzas. Our kids loved the thin crust and my wife and enjoyed a deep dish classic Chicago style. The thing that impressed us the most was the service. There was a guy running around the restaurant doing everything and he had a smile on his face the entire time. Needless to say we will be back. Awesome job!!!

If you're an ex-Chicago guy like me, living in Los Angeles is like living in a Hot Dog desert.

It's not that I would eat hot dogs in Chicago often (not the healthiest of meals).  But when you have a taste for a RealDeal Chicago Dog and cannot quench it, that quench festers -- sometimes for years at a time.

So I was off-the-wall bonkers to discover this Highly-Rated Chicago HotDoggery in the middle of Las Vegas on my last trip there.

It's RealDeal and then some, bless them.  A soft, steamed poppy seed bun filled with the perfectly steamed Vienna Frank then topped with yellow mustard, neon-green pickle relish, chopped onions, a slice of kosher pickle, sliced tomatoes and Louisiana sport peppers, all bathed in a sprinkle of celery salt.  When done properly (as done in this establishment) it truly is a meal that would be fawned over in Paris.  It's that good!

Then to ice it, they serve Chicago-style hot tamales.  They're nothing like the authentic banana leaf tamales as served in L.A., but I guarantee you they taste infinitely better.

Next time you're rolling 7's or pulling that ace to grace your 21, take a break, hop into a taxi and treat yourself to the most fabulous hot dog -- it's gourmet! -- you've ever treated your tastebuds to.

TODAY ONLY July 4, 2017 ... $.99 Chi Dogs!!!! This is such a taste of HOME. This place will always get 5 stars from me ... oh man that's being bias but in the words of SMOKEY from the movie FRIDAY "I don't give a F@ck" ... get there ... oh yeah everything there is great!!!!

One of my friends from Chicago raves about this place, and even asked me to vote for their other location on the Las Vegas Review Journal;s best hot dogs award.  That was couple of years ago, and I never voted for them because I never made to that location, but I have to agree with him now on their sister location.

When I think of Chicago foods, the first thing I that comes to mind is the SNL skit of the Mike Ditka fan's.   Just watching those guys " Kobayashiing" a bunch of dogs, and self-resuscitating themselves back to life after getting a massive heart attack was pretty funny.   Well, this could happen if you ate this way 24/7, 365 days a year, but what the heck....you have to treat yourself once in awhile, and why not here because it's sinfully good.

Located across the parking lot from Krispy Kream on Eastern, Windy City looks small at the door front, but once you walk in, the dining area expands to a pretty good size room.   The staff is super friendly, and I armed with my groupon deal from them...damn, it was a heck of a deal.

I'm no expert on deep dish pizza, but this pie is worth the drive.   Personally, I'm more of thin crust pizza guy, but this pie is my exception.   The crust at it thinnest area is about twice as thick as thin crust pizza, and it does need it because this pizza is packed with Meat, and cheese.   The sweet chunks of tomatoes flows with the sauce on top, and this pie is not weak hearted, because after eating two slices I was done for dinner.   It was tasty, filling, and reminded me of the old Red Lion pizza in Waikiki(back in 1990's)

From what seen on the daily special board, there always a special if your name match the name of day.   Too bad for me, my name beyond uncommon.    Oh well.

I had a few of their sandwiches on another visit, and the Chicago beef was very good, but it was the fries that impressed me.   Yeah, it that kind of place for me, because I will pound some food at this place, and become a honorary Mike Ditka disciple.     If you're from Chicago, this place is home away from home, and my go to spot for deep dish pizza in Las Vegas!

Chichen wings are delicious and pizza is okay. People who work there are not all that friendly but maybe they are just in character, not sure. I wouldn't go back for the pizza but I would go back for the wings

There are many Pizza places around the Las Vegas Valley.  This is the place for great deep dish pizza's and phenomenal Chicago dogs. They have a large seating area and a great staff.  Windy City Beefs n Pizza is my favorite place to eat.

My quest for amazing pizza continues and I must say I'm getting close!

After reading solid reviews from LV Weekly and Seven I figured it was worth a visit.  Tucked away in a strip mall of off Eastern Ave (billed by me as the best road outside of the strip to find good eats), I feel Chicago authenticity when I walk in.  Just like the Vienna sausage company HQ in Chicago, IL, Windy City has yellow walls and plenty of Chicago maps and memorabilia.

The pizza comes in two Chicago styles, a thin crust or deep dish.  This time around I ordered the thin crust which had very melty cheese (not rubbery) and a good amount of sauce and well seasoned toppings.  As an app we had winds with a medium sauce, they didn't look good at first, but they were just the right amount of crisp and the sauce was a nice kick. 

This isn't the normal sorta light and dry thin crust you come to expect at Sammie's or CPK and while I still enjoy those places, I must say that Windy City takes the crown.  Next-up: Deep Dish!

After visiting Chicago last summer, whenever I have the chance to get an Italian beef I jump at the opportunity.  Visiting Vegas for an AAU basketball tourney. We came across this spot and got excited. I must say this spot is pretty official. The beef and the Au jus is spot on and the peppers combo are spicy forming a perfect combination. If you are in that area you need hit that spot if you can't make it to Chicago.
From Chicago- pizza was amazing and authentic. Owner and staff are incredibly friendly. Definitely recommend this place!

Was over a friends house and she decided to order some Chicago style pizza for us. It was my first time trying it, so I was excited. The delivery came sooner than expected, which was great. I loved every bite of it, especially the crust!!  I was so happy I got to try it because now I'm hooked. Will be ordering from here in the future for myself and family!

Deep dish was really, really great! In my opinion, it was much better than the  Giordano's I got in Chicago. 

I also liked the memorabilia on the walls there -- nice touch.

Lastly, I never had a cannoli before, so I can't compare, but it was delicious as well!

The only negative I can point out is that the "salad" was not much of a salad at all--wife and I just used it as burger toppings the next day.

If you're in Las Vegas and want a pizza, this is well worth the short trip. Maybe five miles south on LV Blvd and then a few miles east on Silverado and you're there. Very easy to get to, even for a tourist.
Everything was great. Pizza was phenomenal. The wings were crunchy, golden brown  deliciousness...if you're a fan of pizza, you gotta go here, and definitely get the Chicago deep dish

Best chili cheese tamales w onions. Best Italian beef w spicy giadernia (sp.). Bomb fries and great hot dogs. You cannot go wrong eating here!

Ps. grab a papaya boba slush next door to compliment your meal.
Being from Chicago, this is our "go to" spot for Beef sandwiches & hot dogs!  Friendly staff.  Only thing "missing" is Italian Lemonade!!

If you are looking for a fancy dinning place this place is definitely not the most up to date pizza restaurant you can find! BUT, if you are just here looking for great pizza , great people , great sports and Chicago vibe, this is the place to be, it sort of has a dive bar kind of a feel. 

I was recommended by a friend for their deep dish pizza! And i think it is one of their best things they have here.. maybe they have other great things like the hot dogs but i didnt try them when i was there. They do look delicious on their yelp pictures though. 

I suggest you to call and order ahead for the deep dish pizza, it takes them about 30 plus minutes to make them. Three of us ladies ordered #8 the wings with fries and also a 12 inch deep dish specialty pizza. 

The wings came out in about short 5 minutes, the buffalo sauce is delicious very good with the wings (and also with the pizza when that came out) the bbq sauce felt a bit tangy.   

BUT look at the picture of my deep dish pizza! Not super thick bread , it was filled with lots of cheese, sausage and tomato sauce, i would say it is authentic Chicago deep dish, not those super thick bread ones you find else where here in vegas. The 12 inch can feed about three people, we still had two slices left over after the one order of wings and pizza. It is very fulfilling

Always our go to pizza joint near home. Wings are great...no breading. Deep dish is excellent; I  dare you to eat three slices in one sitting. Thin crust is good too, but better in the restaurant, the crust gets a little greasy on delivery

As of this week, Windy City Beefs in Pizza, is my favorite place for Pizza.  The Pizza reminds me of a really good Geno's East Pizza.  Sausage was excellent and all over the Pizza including the crust.  We got the large deep dish special that included 12 chicken wings.  We devoured as much as we could and still managed to take home half the Pizza.  Infact the Pizza was still excellent the next day!

After going to their original location across town, I realized this gem was just down the street from me. Food is just as good and they have pizza! Had the deep dish slice and pop special and the beef sandwich combo. If you like deep dish you will love this place. The atmosphere was awesome and specials nearly every day. I'm just so impressed with the friendly staff, great food and great prices. This might be my new favorite place.

We found this spot on Yelp after randomly having a taste for Chicago-style food. We were staying on the Vegas strip so the drive was a little hike but I'd say it was worth it. We were greeted by a nice lady at the counter who happily took our order of all Italian beefs with hot giardinera (so much for variety). The food came out quickly and was hot & fresh. The sandwich put me more in the mind of a higher quality Al's Beef sandwich and is probably the best I will get until I'm able to make it back to Chicago. The fries were also pretty tasty but were outshined by the sandwich, of course. Another group ordered a pizza while we were there and it looked pretty good. They menu also consisted of all the Chi-town staples like dogs, Italian sausages, gyros, and pizza puffs. I'd definitely suggest this to anyone in the area looking for some good Chicago eats.
Found this place on Yelp. Pretty neat when you walk in and see all of the Chicago memorabilia. Friendly staff. Food is delicious!!! We had the thin crust and wings. Way better then Pizza Hut.
Excellent chili dogs, fries, & corn dogs, gotta try the pizza next. Fun old school pizza parlor atmosphere & really friendly staff. Top notch all around, recommended.

We came here to redeem a Groupon and noticed a 20 dollar large pizza any choice and wings special going on.  They still offer the free hot dogs for name of the day.  Today it was Vito.  Heyyy Vito!

All of the food was decent - I enjoyed Rosati's more but then again Windy is a lot more affordable and if you live on this side of town I could understand the appeal.

IMO there's better Chicago style options so I won't be going out of my way but it was pretty good.  Def check it out if you live on this side of town.

Deep dish, I did not know your were so very delicious! We ordered the WNCCPRKW??? I don't remember the initials, but I do remember stuffing myself to the point of almost asking my man to carry me out! 
I asked to come here for dinner because of Jamie W's review. We were so delightfully surprised at how much we loved the deep dish, we can't wait to come back and try the beef!
We ordered the large pizza with sausage, mushrooms, onions, black olives, green peppers and giardiniera . It was like a flavor explosion and a delight for all of my senses. The smell of the sauce, the crisp of the crust ( did I taste a hint of butter in that crust?) the crunch of the veggies, the heat of the giardiniera, the creamy meltiness of the cheese. Thank goodness there were leftovers. I just finished a leftover slice and it was as good as last night!
The staff was nice, the place was clean. All that was missing was Coke Zero.

Enjoy, in moderation.

Heard about this place from Natalie K. She liked the wings and staff was pleasant, she has been here multiple times. First impressions are everything, right? Cashier was very rude and wouldn't even give me eye contact, she was short and snappy. I ordered hot wings and fries, she did inform me that the sauce is on the side. Thank you, I then asked for them to be dipped and cooked well done crispy. Wings and fries look great but wasn't as spicy as I would like nor crispy enough. However they were good just not to my personal hot wing liking. I love hot wings

Been there many times. The food is tasty,  great deep dish pizza.  The Ruben sandwiches and hot beefs and hot dogs are really great too. Nice lunch place and the service is very friendly.  Fun place to go to watch the bears.
There deep dish pizza is to die for, reasonable price too. This is one of our favorites now!

This place is great!

I ordered the Italian beef, deep dish pizza and the pizza puff.
The italian beef is delicious. It tastes just like how it is in Chicago. Being a chicago native, I had to check this place out. The deep dish is really good. They give you a lot of food for your money. They even sell oke doke popcorn and jays chip products. 

This is definitely going to be my permanent place if I want some good italian beef.
Overall, I give 5 stars because this place was really clean and the food was hot and fresh.

Almost every time we come visit our friends in Henderson we try to stop at Windy City to go back to our love for Real Chicago style hot dogs, Italian beef sandwiches (dipped) & deep dish pizza. The food is great, service great & they always have a game on!

This place rocks!!!
Delicious, the flavors are amazing. I went simple on my first visit and got the deep dish cheese pizza. It was so good. Will definitely recommend.

Friendly staff.  Yummy fries and Chicago style hot dog.  Hidden away by delicious bundt cake shop.  I'm a ketchup and bun type of hot dog person but this was good.  Fun little place to visit and see the decor.

I love this place. After moving from Chicago to Vegas about 8 years ago my family had been looking for a good Chicago eatery and we found it here. 

It's sorta a whole in the wall but is actually a lot bigger then it looks. Lots of seating, never had a problem with seating even with 7 or 8 people. Lots of really awesome Chicago stuff on the walls.....except all the stupid Cubs stuff. 

The menu is really good. Good size, easy to understand, and has lots of choices. I really like the Italian beef sandwich. Wet. With cheese. The roll they use is really good and doesn't fall apart till the last bite. The meat is always on point and they give you a lot. The fries that come with it, they have more to be desired. They are okay but could be better. I've also had the original Chicago Dog! It's really good, sesame seed bun, green relish, pickle spear, tomatoes. The whole package. I really really really really really like that they have Green River soda and Jays brand chips. The prices aren't bad but could be a little bit cheaper. Staff is always nice and friendly. The one weird thing is sometimes they have these specials where if your name is Tom for example they give you a free hot dog. Or if you have a birthday that month they will give you a free drink. Haha I've never had it happen to me but it sounds good! 

If you are from Chicago or like Chicago food and are looking for something authentic I'd definitely suggest this place!

I just patronized this fine establishment on a recent trip to Las Vegas and was very very very pleased with the great quality of the Italian Beef Sandwhich I had there.

I had mine "dipped" with medium giardiniera sauce.  The sauce was only a three out of five, but the Italian Beef sandwhich itself was an unqualified 5/5.

Jonesing Chicagoans will not be disappointed.

Great atmosphere, great deep dish, and fun place for Bears games on Sundays. They have a giant projector that makes watching easy for everyone. Ownership is very involved in the business and puts in an obvious effort to make the experience worth while.

My love for pizza is no secret to anyone who talks to me for five seconds. Windy City Deep Dish is my current steady.

Five stars. really? Eff yes. The pie is perfect in my eyes. The sauce is the best pizza sauce I've had in months. Chunky, sweet, not spicy. Just perfect. The crust is crispy, yet soft in some spots and buttery. Other Deep Dish pies I've had have been entirely too doughy for my taste. Not this one. Also it's not too deep. I could eat this shit for every meal and I have....It's even good cold. My one tiny complaint about this is when you are dining in the restaurant they give you a plastic spork to eat with. I don't know if the owners have tried doing this, but it just doesn't work. Maybe they have flimzy sporks just to laugh at us. I ended up flicking the sauce all over my shirt which sucked since I was going to a party after. Yes, instead of pregaming on vodka at home (so 2010) I pregame with some deep dish pizza.

As far as the BEEF in Windy City Beefs N Pizza I can't and won't give my opinion just yet. I haven't tried it, but I am sure I will at some point. Chicago dogs are one of my favorite food groups so I will let you know whaz up when that happens. 

Customer service is beyond great here. When I have dined in they check on you, but not to the point of annoying. Also, I ordered pizza to go and when I got it home I realized the crust was overdone. Seeing as though I paid $17 for a 12" za I called the restaurant to let them know. I spoke to Dakota who happens to be one of the owners and he apologized and said he would make me a new pizza and have it delivered right away. When getting up to get the order number I spilled the god damn Ranch dressing all over my pants, feet, couch and carpet like a champ. When my new za arrived 40 minutes later it was piping hot and had two Ranch dressings in the box. The owner delivered it himself and apologized again and collected the overdone pizza to show to the staff. Customer Satisfuckinfaction.

I don't know shit if it tastes like REAL Chicago pizza and frankly I feel bad for you folks who have to compare everything to that. What I do know is it tastes amazing to me. I've had to stop myself from going back there everyday since. Please give it a shot and share the carb guilt with me pa-lease.

Had the gyro and fries. Delicious, reminded me of Chicago diners I used to visit.
Can't wait to go back and try other items.

I had the two Chicago dogs and fries. It delivered on having an authentic style hotdog with all the traditional windy city fixings. Price was fair and portion was good even for a big fellow like me. I loved the celery salt on the dog, it gave that extra pop to go with the tomatoes and sport peppers. Can't wait to try their pizzas!!

My review will be just for the deep dish pizza I had. Got a Groupon for a 14" pizza (w/ 4 choices of toppings). Two salads and two cannolis for $16.99. Get it while you still can! its a phenomenal deal! http://www.groupon.com/deals/windy-city-beefs-n-pizza 

The pizza was absolutely delicious. Seriously The Best pizza I have ever had. It looked nothing like the deep dish pizza they had on their menu, but it tasted so good I could care less. The crust was perfection and that comes from someone who doesn't care for crust. The cheese was a wonderful melty, gooey yumminess. I chose mushroom, sausage, pepperoni and green peppers for my toppings. The sauce was perfectly seasoned. It was awesome! 

The salad was mediocre. Nothing spectacular, but I didn't come for salad so I could care less what the salad was. And for the value I got in the pizza from the Groupon it made up for your basic shredded iceberg lettuce, a few tomatoes, and sliced carrot. I believe the pizza alone would have been $21.50

I was so full after gouging on that fabulous pizza I couldn't fit the cannoli, but I did take a bite of it to taste. The filling was good. Not too sweet. Creamy sweetened cream cheese with bits of chocolate chips. It tasted like cream cheese anyway. I don't think it was ricotta. 

They have a 50 cent wing Tuesday with a minimum of 6 wings per order. Unfortunately I didn't order any because I knew we weren't going to be able to finish the pizza. The next time in Vegas we are definitely going to stop here for pizza again and hope to try some wings. I will come even if they don't have a Groupon because the pizza is awesome!!

Though I love the pizza and hot dogs here, today I tried and did not like anything about the Italian beef sandwich. They dip the entire sandwich in au jus which made it totally impossible to pick up as the bread was mush and fell apart. The meat was not tender or flavorful either YUCK! ...so disappointed.

Food is great. This review isn't about the food. It's about the woman cashier. She is rude and she has a thing for making people feel stupid, apparently. I wanted a slice of pizza, but she very rudely pointed up at the menu and said that it was only available on weekdays. Sorry I couldn't see the really small print! And besides that, I think that's ridiculous to only serve slices on weekdays. And anything else I asked about, her answers were rude and short. I felt very rushed. Her attitude was terrible and it seems like she just wanted us gone, even tho it was barely busy in there. After looking at a few reviews on here, I see that a lot of other people complained about her too. You're in customer service, learn how to be polite and treat people! Also, if you hate your job so much then please consider one that isn't in customer service.

I went to Windy City Beefs N Pizza in December 2014 for dinner with a friend on our way back to Los Angeles.  We took two deep dish pizzas, and the food was pretty good, but unfortunately not as good as a real Chicago deep dish pizza which is what I was hoping to get here.

The restaurant was almost empty when we arrived (It was about 12pm) so there was absolutely no wait to be seated. The service was decently fast and nice. The restaurant is in a strip mall and has a very large parking lot where it is very easy to find a spot. The atmosphere inside the restaurant was pretty nice and very "Chicago" with a lot of baseball and city references.

The price is also quite reasonable for what you get.

Overall, my experience with Windy City Beefs N Pizza was quite positive and I would recommend it if you're looking for a pretty cheap pizza on your way back to Los Angeles from the strip. Feel free to message me for any additional details that you may need!

Don't let the photos on here deceive you. I definitely did. I had never had "Chicago" deep dish pizza before. I decided to try this place because it had great reviews. After trying today, I'm not sure why it does. My pizza was absolutely terrible. The crust was stale, and the cheese and pepperoni was not even cooked all the way. My pizza overall really had no taste either. Unfortunately, never having had deep dish prior to this, I have nothing else to compare it to. However, I still have hope that this place is not a reflection of what real Chicago deep dish pizza is like. Not sure why this place has such great reviews, super disappointing in my honest opinion. Would not recommend this place to anyone.

I had the number 4 (half beef sandwich and a Chicago hot dog) with their hot pepper mixture, the only gripe I have is that their hot peppers were a medium at best. The food otherwise the food was great, the service was great and they have a small but decent selections of beers to pair which was a nice relief from the normal strip mall bud or bud light. I'll definitely return!

This place is really good. I have been coming here since right after they opened.  Their food is always good and fresh. The employees are super friendly as well and they make people feel like family. Tina is a doll. EAT HERE and you will not be disappointed, especially if you are from Chicago, it will satisfy your craving!

Love this place. A true Chicago spot if there ever was one. Great food, and their place is very clean and well lit. Love the
Chicago dogs.

Once I found out my husband loved Chicago style hotdogs I made it my mission to find a place that would satisfy him. Pizza puffs are something you have to try for yourself. With its best In Vegas 2015 rating we had to come. We weren't disappointed. Already planning on bringing our family over here.

My girlfriend, best friend and myself literally stumbled upon this place by chance; we were walking around looking for another place and I finally got tired and said "How 'bout this?". I will admit that I am not a fan of deep-dish pizza, favoring the Neapolitan style crust we make at home. For once I didn't get my way, being out voted 2-1 in favor of the Chicago style house specialty. 
    I griped that the pizza was going to take 30 minutes. I whined to my girlfriend that I didn't like deep dish. I told my best friend that his favorite football team sucked and I suspected he was gay. I stewed in the smoldering resentment of my own girlfriend and best friend betraying my superior knowledge of what constitutes good pizza. 

Then it arrived.  

Thick, perfectly cooked, thin wisps of motz cheese clinging for life as each slice was pulled away. In short, it was the fucking bomb. Even if you are not a deep dish fan (like myself) I would highly encourage you to try a pie from Windy City; just learn from my experience and don't say shit until you taste it.

Had this place bookmarked for a while. Really wanted to try the italian beef.
So, after a not so great visit to Taco y Taco, decided to come here for some more food.
We ordered the sandwich and you can get it 3 ways....dry, with a ladle of au jus, or the whole sandwich dipped. We opted for the ladle. Also, you can add cheese and gardinere, which we did. 
I guess I should have ordered dry with au jus on side, because I did not care for the amount of juice on it. It made the bread completely soggy and we ate in and had it fresh, and it was sooooo soggy. Like, borderline gross, but the flavor was pretty good.
I wasn't impressed with the gardinere at all. I thought it would be tastier, or better and it was just eh.
I doubt I'd come back to this location, as it's far from me, but I would like to have that sandwich again, and I believe the have a location near Summerlin.

So Good! I Picked Up 2 Orders from them in 2 Weeks The first time the Lady was so Cool they where about to Close & I Told her I was just watching some food show with Chicago Beef! She said Sure No Problem! What would you like I Love There Beef & Peppers & I get the Juice on the Side to Dip it in So Yummy! If You are from Chicago You will love it! There pizza is good to but I can not get past the beef

Hot Dog was not bad and is about as close to a Chicago dog that you can get here in Vegas.  The Fries are the wrong type to be sold as Chicago Style. The rest......eh. The beef is a pre-cooked product as told by the person behind the counter. The great beef stands in Chicago roast their own beef and use seasonings that may vary from place to place , but have a much better flavor than what I found here. The bread which is an big part of the Beef Sandwich is a thick crusted bread that soaks up the juices without getting doughy. Not the case here. The pizza........ forgetaboutit. It is not at all real Chicago style. I grew up in a family that owned a top Pizza-aria that was well known in the area. We were in business over 60 years. My Great Grandfather was one of the first to bring Beefs and Pizza to Chicago. If you want authentic, this is not it.  If you have come to like mediocre food called Chicago Style then this is what you get.

I have been wanting to try this place ever since I saw the photos that fellow yelper Shirley B. posted of her meals here.

They have a location on Lake Mead & Buffalo that is much closer to my house but, I noticed an event submitted by another yelper Jaime W., that they were opening this newer location and having a grand opening special where the whole day everyone got 50% off the whole total dine-in bill! How could I not help support a local business and take advantage of such a great discount?!?! The place was packed! I was so glad that we were even able to get a table. The wait for our food was almost an hour but we knew upon walking in that it was a mad house inside and wanted to wait it out. Staff came by to talk to us regularly. It was nice to see all the support this place was getting. Since I knew we were getting 50% off the whole bill I figured this was a good way to sample several things and see what I liked and didn't. Here it goes!

The "Chicago Deep Dish Cheese Pizza" was by far the best part of the meal. The sauce is sweet and super tasty. The crust is thick and crisp on the bottom and chewy in the middle. I would always order this! The sad part is they told us that they only make pizza at this Eastern location. The Lake Mead location makes hot dogs and sandwiches. We would make the drive to this Eastern location just for the pizza!

Next was the "Windy City's Chicago Style Hot Dog". This is a spot on Chicago dog people! We are talking a Vienna all beef hot dog with a steamed (makes such a difference in how the dog comes together) Vienna poppy seed bun, mustard, onion, green relish, pickle, tomato, sport peppers and celery salt. The green relish is to die for! I recommend this for sure!

I wasn't impressed with the "Windy City's Chicago Style Italian Beef Sandwich". It had no flavor. If any of you have ever eaten at a "Portillo's" or "Al's Beef" in Chicago then you know what  good Italian beef is and this one here at WCBNP just doesn't cut it. I am willing to give this sandwich another try though since they were so busy maybe something was off and we did order multiple things. This sandwich was no reason not to give a 5 star review still because everything else was perfect.

We tried the "Windy City's Maxwell Polish" and I personally liked it. My man thought it was too charred on the outside but I like mine burnt! This one is a Vienna Polish sausage and you can get it plain or spicy, we chose spicy. They steam the sausage then grill it and serve it on a Vienna poppy seed muffin with mustard, grilled onions and sport peppers. 

I wanted to try their fries so I ordered the "Full Basket Of Chili Cheese Fries". I had them add onions. This was so good, but chili had an off flavor. Chili with no beans wasn't the issue. The fries were great. 

The place is clean and I noticed someone always wiping things down.

They serve beer and wine.

You can place an order for delivery! Call to find out if you are in the delivery area! They deliver up to 5 miles from WCBNP and charge $3.00 for delivery.

Check their website for monthly specials and coupons.

They do not accept personal checks or American Express. They do accept cash, visa, discover, and master card.

Outside is plenty of seating and in the middle of the seating is a peaceful sounding waterfall. So relaxing on a nice day I bet.

Lastly, go try this place!

Some of the best pizza I've had since moving out of New York! We had the Chicago-style deep dish pizza, my half had sausage and anchovie, and my boyfriend's half had pepperoni and mushroom. Both tasted great! The sauce is nice and thick, authentic and delicious. They put it on top so all the cheese and toppings stay on the crust.

We also started our meal with the pretzels, which was a mistake. Not because they were bad, they were awesome! Nice and yeasty, just how I like. The cheese sauce was smooth and creamy with just a little black pepper. The problem was that our eyes were bigger than our stomachs and we couldn't finish our pizza, no matter how hard we tried.

The hot dogs are good too, but the pizza is where it's at. The lady at the counter was also very friendly and patient while we decided what to get. We've tried a few other pizza joints but we always come back to Windy City!

Italian beef  (wet)  is the best IN TOWN 
So is their Deep dish Pizza !!!!  Don't waste your time driving around on the west side for Chicago food !!!
Pizza Puffs are Awesome !!!

So i moved over to this side of town and while i was unpacking I wanted to get something to eat.  I saw this place in the shopping center and I was in a mood for a hotdog.  Man they are fantastic.  I would go back just for that.  As well as the customer service was top notch.  The cashier there was very helpful and ncie to me on my first time.  I went back recently for dinner with a friend.  We had a deep dish pizza a salad and some cannolis for dessert.  Oh man nothing short of amazing.  Everything was prepared nicely.  We brought it back to my place and everything was till hot and tasty.  I can not praise this place more.  If you are into deep dish pizza please go to this place, it is fantastic.

Authentic Chicago cuisine. Exceptional. Super friendly staff. 

During a 36hr visit to Las Vegas, my wife and I went twice. It's that good. I was born in Chicago so I know when the flavor is tuned properly. This spot has it dialed in. 

We had a slice of deep dish sausage pizza. It was perfect. Twice. 

We had a Chicago hot dog. It was perfect. (Only ate it on day one ;-)

We had an Italian combo sandwich or 3 as well. Italian sausage smothered in Italian beef. We added medium giardiniera and sweet peppers and had the au jus on the side. Perfection. Beyond great. Damn that was good! 

Prices were fair in my opinion. You know that the food was well worth the money when you contemplate paying for a whole 'nother trip just to eat at a restaurant! Yep. That good. 

Nuff Said.

Maybe I should have gotten what there famous for.  I got a hamburger....Yea, at a pizza place!  WHAT WAS I THINKING!
I was thinking, they might have pizza by the slice!   They didn't so, I had to go for something else.  I really didn't want to spend $11.00 on a cheese pizza!  It was only for me, so all I wanted was a slice....Boo hoo hoo!  Ohhh well, maybe one day, they might cross my mind, and I will want to try a Chicago style pizza, but I'm not going to break my neck to run back over there!
My first experience was awesome.  The pizza reminds me of Chicago.  Delivery was fast and pizza was hot

First experience with Chicago Deep Dish and loved every minute of it! Instead of ordering from the same old chain of pizza places, I pulled up yelp to check out reviews for local pizza places. Reviewers weren't wrong! Cheesy, tomato saucy goodness layered on a crunchy, buttery crust. It was so good! Accurate delivery time and they didn't forget the sauce for the wings! The wings were also good! We will be ordering from them again!
Pizza was very tasty and the wings are nice and crunchy.  Very pleased with the food.  Service was ok. We will be back!

Now THAT is how you make a hot dog!!! I had two Chicago Style dogs and they were incredible! Loved the Sport Peppers on top and they were cooked to perfection! I was nervous when I walked in and saw catsup on the table, but was quickly comforted by the nice girl working as she told me that was for the fries. Of course I squirted said catsup in a completely separate container, not even close to the dogs, as I am American! :-) You can be sure I will be there every Vegas trip I make, but encourage others to try for themselves. Well done, Windy City! You did good! -Joe (San Diego)

All I can say is that the customer service over the phone was very rude. The woman kept asking me to repeat myself louder and louder then scolded me to "not yell" at her. Then she had me repeat my credit card number at least 5 times even though she had the correct number. Also, don't call me "hon". In the end, I would not want to call here again and deal with their customer service even if the pizza is good.

I have been wanting to try this place for a few months, I live in the Centennial Hills part of town and drove 30 miles to try this place. So you can say I had quite a high expectation. It is a bit tucked away in its location but once you find it its a pretty neat spot themed with Chicago stuff everywhere. 

What we ordered:
2 orders of Wings with Fries
Meat specialty 14 inch Deep Dish

We killed the wings before even getting the Pizza. (Deep Dish takes half hour to bake) They were great and worth ordering again. 

Finally the long anticipated Deep Dish came out and it was HUGE.
Loads of meat and cheese, 3 grown males could barely finish two slices. 

Was it worth the drive, price and wait?
For me, Yes. A must try spot that I highly recommend to all.

Good deep dish pizza, however I've had better -- Giordanos in Chicago and Zachary's in the Bay Area, California. I would go back since they are literally down the street from me. However they've messed up our orders on 2 separate occasions, not cool since my GF is allergic to certain things.. 

Sorry guys I won't be going back and will try some of the other Chi-town deep dish pizza alternatives in Vegas.

I am from chicago and have had some great pizza.But windy city has some issues with their pizza.It lacks flavor, as is having no flavor at all. it is greasy and is overpriced as is most of the items on the menu.The staff are usually friendly.I will definitely go for a pizza puff and fry or beef sandwich cause my options are limited.If a Portillos opens up i would be worried for this place!!

There is so much to write about but if you go, remember to order the fries. Wow, is all I can say. They seem to follow the McDonald's method which is to boil the potato in salted water for a few minutes then fry them to a golden brown. Trust me, that salt bath makes all the difference in smell, taste, and texture vs regular cut and fried fries. But here I am going on about the fries when this is a pizza place... 

There seemed to have been a large number of locals picking up lunch (always a good sign), and they do sell pizza by the slice. We ordered the Chicago Deep Dish and that baby was piled high with cheese and stewed tomatoes, the works. I have never been so full that they had to roll me out of the restaurant like Veruca Salt in Willy Wonka to have me "dejuiced." Super friendly staff that made me feel welcome, I will always visit when I am in the area.

It's like being in Chicago in Henderson.   Every time I am in town I have to stop here first.   The best food, people and atmosphere.  If you are from Chicago or love the city this is the place for you.   Feels like home.

This is by far the best place in Vegas to have authentic Chicago dogs!! And to top it off? Everything else is delicious too!!! They have hot wings, fries, pizza (both thin crust and deep dish) and sell beer by the buckets!!! Can someone please say perfection!?!?

The place is always super clean, the brightly painted walls are covered in Chicago sports teams jerseys, photos, etc. & has tv's everywhere for all to enjoy! Gets pretty crowded w/Bears fans during the games & theyve got drink/app specials & raffles goin on at this time too! Staff is always very friendly and accurate, service is speedy & smiles all around.  

Its not in the best location, as its tucked in an inside corner of a strip mall kind of hidden from main roads, so look hard for this place, bc its Definately worth checkin out!

I'm a huge fan of this restaurant.  As a life-long Chicagoan and fairly recent transplant to Las Vegas, I can't endorse their food enough.  The service is great and everything tastes like it did back in Chicago.  Real Vienna beef and hot dogs, S. Rosen poppyseed buns, pizza puffs, Jay's potato chips, Old Style beer and Green River soda can all be found here!  

I've had the pizza and the thin crust is crisp with just the right amount of sauce and cheese.  The deep dish has a sweet tomato sauce on top and the pepperoni actually has a little bit of spice to it, which is way better than the bland stuff the chains use.  The crust is a butter crust similar to Lou Malnati's or Ricobene's deep dish.

The hot dogs are made authentic Chicago-style (no ketchup) and include the neon green relish, mustard, celery salt and sport peppers on a Vienna beef dog with a poppyseed bun.  Can't get any better than that.

The Italian beef is by far my favorite.  On an Italian roll, of course you have to get it dipped so the bread is falling apart and the au jus runs down your arm.  If you like spicy stuff, get their homemade hot giardinera made with habanero peppers.  No need to thank me.

I highly recommend this place, especially if you already "know" Chicago food.

True definition of Chicago flavor! They are family owned and operated and never skimp on the serving. They also carry all the Vienna brand product for the absolute best all beef Chicago dogs! I had my usual Italian Beef (wet) with sweet peppers and Giardiniera the pic speaks for itself! Im in heaven! This meal is not for the faint at heart .......dieters beware lol

Being from Chicago I love this place it has true authentic food that is made out of real ingredients. I love it here. It is so nice here. Plus on Fridays they have a deep dish pizza special that comes with their amazing wings
The double Italian sausage sandwich is bomb...I get it without peppers and onions, but I add marinara and cheese...grub!  On Tuesdays they have a chicken wing special...well worth it!

This review is based off of my first visit where I ordered the sausage beef combo and a tamale on side. I thought it was absolutely delicious! This is a place where you don't want to share! Other visitors ordered the pizza and it to looks delicious. They have a calendar with daily specials. I will definitely return to try one of the specials. The price point was a little high, but visit with a coupon and you will be just as pleased as I was.

Had the deep dish and it reminded us of home...lots of cheese and toppings...wings were good as well...both good sizes...quick delivery....
only issue as we see often in these types of places...plastic utensils just don't cut it!!
Lazy worker lady answering phone didn't want to deliver. Owner would be pissed at the service given. They said we are 14 miles away - but... We are 2.1 - ridiculous.

I love this place. Being from Chicago, it hits home with all the decor (newspaper articles, photos, posters, memorabilia for every Chicago sports team) and to top it off, the food is FANTASTIC and reasonably priced! They even keep Jays chips in stock! I recently brought my boyfriend here to give him a taste of my hometown, we both got the #4, we were full for the whole day and only spent $10 each. Everyone is so nice here, the owner has been in every single time I've come, you can tell that they care about their business and their customers. Stop in for a hot dog, Italian beef or deep dish pizza, grab a beer and watch the game. This place is the spot for homesick Chicagoans or anyone who wants great food and a great atmosphere

Can we say totally delicious! First of all, my fellow midwestern people will not be disappointed in huge bags of Jay's for sale! Yummy!! The pizza was delicious, and I'd like to say I am seasoned when it comes to pizza. It was clean, decorated with all types of Chicago paraphernalia and a great dining experience. Sean, Dakota and Abraham were very pleasant and we will definitely return. It's nice to go into a place that makes you feel great before and after you leave. Lastly, the Giardiniera is definitely worth writing home about. I can't wait to go before 4 pm to take advantage of the specials they have during the day (hence, slice of deep dish pizza and pop for $5 on Mondays!) or $1.50 Chicago dogs on Tuesdays! Thank you Windy City Beefs and Pizza!!!

To start off my review of the most immaculate pizza I've had in a while, I'll paraphrase the 2001 classic, one barely edged out by A Beautiful Mind to win Best Picture of that year, Legally Blonde.

Pizza gives you endorphins, endorphins make you happy. Happy people just don't shoot their husbands. They just don't.

I couldn't agree with this sentiment more, except I would probably seriously maim anybody who tried to stand in the way of me and this pizza. 

Deep dish is a while wait, but when you've got a place to sit outside, good company, and Nothing Bundt Cakes next door, what's the problem? Wait for the feast you're about to embark on.

A huge selection of toppings and of combos for Chicago dogs. The deep dish is crispy but then doughy towards the middle just the way it should be. I snarfed 3 pieces before I realized that I may go into cardiac arrest before the day was done. Then I ate the leftovers (heated up in the oven like bosses do) for dinner the next day and I was in heaven all over again.

The place is small but the owners are CRAZY nice and their service excellent. As Jaime mentioned, it's hard to cut with plasticware but next time I'll come prepared with a metal fork and knife. No really, I probably will.
32 years growing up in Chicago.  this place is heaven for me. the hot dogs, beef,  and deep dish pie are beyond fabulous

Great service, delicious hot dogs and pizzas!!
Portions are monsters sized but very delicious

My roommate called Windy City tonight to place a delivery order from his cell & Tina answered, she was extremely rude and nasty saying "We don't deliver to you, your out of our 5 miles zone" Which is a complete crock because on April 8th at 8:19pm I placed an order for delivery with Nena V check number 126, Approval code for my debit card is 041923. Yes I have the receipt which everyone can on Windy City's Facebook Page. My roommate then called back and asked to speak with the manager because her attitude was so bad and the fact she lied to him about the delivery, he wanted to let someone know. Well when he called back and asked for the manager she proceeds to say "Oh Jeff, well the manager is cooking he will call you back" He is from Chicago, He Loves the food here and even got me admit Chicago does better pizza and I'm from New York. but after this experience we both will NEVER go there again. We rather drive to the other side of town and go their location on Lake Mead. Also watch out for out for this locations apparent bad business practices because I just noticed on my bank statement they charged me $38.13. I did NOT give a $10 dollar tip!!!!!!   If you notice on the receipt I was already charged $3.00 for a tip!!!!

Came here with the pizza posse. I've always been a die hard Chicago style pizza lover (and hot dog too). My first stop in Chicago is Gino's, Lou's, Portillo's and Hot Doug's. Yes I will eat all in one day. I love a good, flaky crust. This pizza had a great crust, along with big meaty pieces of tomato. The kicker, they have giardineira. YES I love giardineira on my pies, but I wasn't in love with the brand they carry. My only complaint is the pizza could have been left in a tad longer, the sauce was on the lukewarm side. Since it is deep dish, plan to wait 45-60mins for it to cook. We passed the time by splitting a hot dog. They are pretty small, but perfect for an appetizer. I do realize I'm not in Chicago so I'm not gonna get all crazy and compare them to the real deal, but this can definitely suffice in between my trips. Try the frozen cheescake for dessert.

I LOVE AND MISS THIS PLACE SO MUCH!!!!!

My husband and I lived in Las Vegas these past two years and before that we were born and raised in Chicago. When we moved to Las Vegas we found this place right away! And WOW! It's just like being at home!!! Best hot dogs and sandwiches in Las Vegas! I can't get enough of their Chicago Dogs and their chili cheese dogs! Their Ruben and their Italian beef sandwiches are amazing too!! You just can't go wrong with anything you order here!

In short - really good Italian beef (strongly recommend getting it wet), passable Chicago deep dish, but thought the hot dogs were overdone.

+1* for being a local independent spot and have always found the servers friendly. Plus love the decor with all the memorabilia and vintage pics / newspaper postings.

Bottom line is that if I need a deep dish fix and don't want to go to the Strip (and wait forever there) for Giordano's, this place will get the job done.

Tip: If you get deep dish takeout, bring a big garbage bag or tray to put the pies in so the oil runoff doesn't spill in the car.

Real Chicago Style Hot Dogs w/ all the Proper Fixins' = YES 

Delicious!

Be sure to check out their deals available at Groupon. Paid $19 for one 14" deep dish pizza with 2 toppings (pepperoni & sausage) 2 side salads and 2 cannoli.

Chicago style pizza was on point. It's high edge and deep surface crust for the large amounts of cheese, chunky tomato sauce and toppings will blow you away to "Windy City" with every bite. You choose the salad dressing for the garden salad and their cannoli's are divine. 

The dining area is decorated with Chicago memorabilia.

So disappointed in this 'taste of Chicago'!  Being from Chicago, whenever I see a restaurant that advertises its product as authentic Chicago food, I have to try it.  Tonight I stopped by to order the Italian beef/sausage combos for takeout from Windy City Beefs 'n Pizza.  The young lady behind the counter kept insisting how Chicago authentic the food was, but when asked if she was from Chicago, she stated no.  However, on with my order, the "Chicago" beef.  First of all, the sandwich didn't consist of "thin slices" of beef as described in their menu but instead the beef in the sandwich was in very small pieces.  And something that is repetitive all over the Valley when it comes to so-called "Chicago" beef sandwiches -- if you order a beef sandwich with sausage (called a combo), the amount of beef in the sandwich is minimal, nothing like Chicago!  In Chicago when you order a combo, besides the sausage, they smother the sandwich with beef piled high.  The bread had no consistency; it was soggy and falling apart.  And, it was shocking to see what Windy City calls giardiniera.  It's nowhere near authentic Chicago giardiniera.  Chicago giardiniera does not have jalapenos and the oregano in it was way too much.  It was spicy and tasteless.  Unbelievable!  As for their pizzas, looking at what the customers were eating reminded me of Tombstone pizzas.  Just saying.  

There is nothing of Chicago here.  Too many disappointments!  Won't return, for sure!
Since my Chicago hot dog closed on rancho...I'm pleased to say this place was a fantastic  find.  Eben has the beef tamale  from elk Grove! I'll definitely be back

Closest thing to Chicago pizza I have found here in Vegas. I have only tried a few pizza places but this is the best by far. Now I have try the beef and see if it measures up also. Great job so far keep up the good work.

As a Chicagoan, I'm critical of my food that has a Chicago stamp on it. I came here the first time as a homesick new resident of Vegas and had the most comforting, welcoming, and home-like experience possible. Chicago memorabilia all over the walls, a place for me to mark where in Chicago I'm from, and the friendly faces of former Chicagoans dying to talk about their memories of home.

The food is dead on!! I've gotten thin crust pizza and dipped beefs here and I could have cried it was all so right. Coke products to accompany the food as well as books of old hot-spots. If I could, I'd eat here all the time for a little piece of home again. Thank you guys for making my experience so great!

Ok so I contacted the business and we were erroneously charged a delivery charge, not for a tip. The owner Dakota said to come back in and we would have a credit waiting for us, true to their word and then some!  We are waiting for our deep dish pizza right now! Great that they corrected their error and made good on the promise, highly recommend this place!!!

I've never lived in Chicago, but I love love love their traditional eats. Pizza, beef sandwiches, and hot dogs - yum! Windy City serves up all those staples, plus a few extras like chicken wings and sausages. 
We came in on a Saturday for lunch and they had a steady stream of customers, but we had no problem finding a table. We ordered a pepperoni thin crust, an italian beef, and a side order of fries. All were good. The beef was delicious - lean and plentiful - no fat blobs here! We ordered with cheese, sweet peppers, and giardinera (sp?), which was pretty spicy for medium. I don't think a baby like me could handle the hot. The pizza was a good, solid pie, and the leftovers tasted great the next day, too. I'll have to come back to sample the deep dish. Surprisingly, the fries were very good, sprinkled with some kind of a seasoned salt and plenty crispy.
They have lots of specials, like half price Fridays (I think), 50-cent wing Wednesdays, and a couple other ones I forget.
Prices are definitely reasonable - our pizza, beef, fries, and 2 drinks came to about $26.
For dessert, you can go next door to Nothing Bundt Cakes or on the other side of the parking lot to Freed's.
The atmosphere inside is very welcoming to families - no liquor license (at least not yet), and lots of kids running around.
This is going to be a tradition every time I visit Vegas. Deep dish was so delicious!

After several more visits to this fine establishment I feel compelled to provide an update. The place is still good. Love the Chicago style pizza: enough bread and cheese to kill a donkey (to Chi-pizza newcomers this is a good thing).  Two slices and you won't be able to eat for days..... Heavenly. 

Only one thing prevents me from giving this place 5 stars: that AWFUL Sammy Sosa jersey hanging on the wall.  Lose that idiot's jersey and replace it with something else.... Bang! 5 Stars!

I'm convinced that an Italian beef with spicy giardinera double-dipped will run you.for.life.  Few things are more delicious, more drippy, gooey, herby, spicy, crunchy. All endorphin receptors firing. Napkins needed for the grass as it creeps down your arms to your elbows.  Look, I'm not a professional beef sandwich aficionado but I'd like to think I could be and never gain weight but sadly, I didn't get that get out of food jail free card...me? I think of one and I gain 5 to 10.  But eating one, yegods, this one is good and from what I understand these sandwiches don't often come with happy people. My people tell me that the norm is a cash only, cranky grimy stand up joint is the norm.   This place?  Go see for yourself.   Oh. Eat.  Way more fun than seeing.  Other addictive (so I'm told) foods like deep dish pizza, etc are on menu too.

My introduction to Italian beef was through the new franchise of Al's Beef over on Sahara and Rainbow. I actually got a little bit of face time on the Yelp Las Vegas home page for that, so I felt the pressure to compare it to this place, which I hadn't tried until today. It helped that I found a Groupon for non-pizza items (so no, this is not at all a pizza review), and I decided to try a few different meats in buns.

First up, the Italian beef (#10). It's in a similar price range to Al's. It seems to be slightly better seasoned and herbed. Unfortunately, it didn't hit the palate quite as hard as Al's did. I think the beef may be a bit better, and the giardiniera looks more authentic and feels that way with the mix of veggies and peppers, but the au jus did not match up to Al's in terms of umami, and I'm thinking the bread may not be as durable. And yes, I got it dipped here as well. Small edge to Al's for just the overall impression.

Second, I had some of the Double Italian Sausage (#12). This is where Windy City Beefs fell flat for me. My comparison this time was to a well known purveyor of foods... which is a Costco food court in Virginia. Yes, they serve an Italian sausage sandwich at Costco on that coast. And yes, I actually would prefer to eat that one again. There was not enough sweetness in the onions and peppers or savoriness in the sausage here, and this one is significantly more pricey.

Finally, I tried a bit of the Polish sausage (#45) with fries. I actually was snacking on the shoestring fries with the other sandwiches, and keeping in mind that taking the fries to-go destroyed the texture (so it's not really the restaurant's fault), I thought the flavor was pretty good. That's all I can really say about that. As for the Polish sausage, it was really good and had so much more flavor than the Italian sausage. Sport peppers weren't actually all that bad for my palate, although they were unexpected. Anyway, this pretty much saved the average.

So, two good options out of three, and maybe future Groupons? I think I could see myself coming back. But I'm still kinda sad that I live way across town from Al's. That's my story and I'm stickin' to it.
I'm from Chicago and this place felt like back home. Walk in and everything is Chicago.. hotdogs we're Chicago style and fries were good. New favorite place :)
Love the pizza puff and Chicago dogs. Coming from Chicago this is the best representation.

My husband really likes this place. A lot. I like the face that they remember my name when I walk in. I love the Chicago hotdogs, not a fan of the round pizza cut into squares.  That's just weird. But the dogs and Italian beef are awesome. The service is excellent as well.

If you are coming to Windy City Beefs N Pizza on a day a Chicago sports team is playing, be prepared for a crowded restaurant.  I came in yesterday around noon and Da Bears were playing.  There was a big projector screen and several TVs all showing the game.  The restaurant was nearly at capacity with only a very few open seats.  It wasn't terribly rowdy but there was a fair amount of noise coming from the fans and TVs.  For these reasons I decided I would take my lunch to go.

I ordered a #10 dipped with medium giardiniera. That is to say an Italian beef sandwich dipped (submerged) in au jus (gravy I believe they call it) with added medium spice pickled vegetables.  I had a craving for one of these sandwiches for months.  It was worth the wait.

When you order a dipped sandwich, it comes out incredibly soggy.  Clearly a result of being dunked like carnival clown in a tank.  It is nearly impossible to eat.  That is if you try to eat it like a regular sandwich.  You will go through napkins like crazy as the juice drips down your arm and all over the table.  The added vegetables give a much needed crunch to this otherwise soft sandwich.  Not to mention the spice and zing of the brine.  It all comes together as something wholly desirable.  My go to sandwich from a place like this.

We went today with the Groupon deal. I expected it to be a quiet, slow place but it seemed to have a steady stream of people. We ordered and when I asked about how long the deep dish takes, they said 30 minutes. Luckily we had our salads to keep us occupied. Salad was good. The lettuce was fresh and green. It was topped with purple onion and two tomato slices. Could have used some shredded cheese just to make it look more appealing. Husband for the ranch and I got the creamy garlic dressing. They were both good. The garlic dressing was more of the consistency of mayo but it had a good taste. The pizza came out faster than 30 minutes. It was the perfect the perfect temp. Not so hot that we had to wait. It was huge! There was so much cheese! The cheese oozed off the peices. It was was delicious! The crust was crispy on the edges yet still soft under the cheese. It really was delicious! We didn't try the cannolis that were including in the deal because we were so full. We took them to go. We will for sure be back for the pizza. It was really good and would feed a lot of people since one piece is so big! The service was good. The lady was nice. It seemed they were having a problem in the kitchen and the guy in the back seemed irritated with the cashier but that had nothing to do with our transaction. One thing I did notice was there were several customers that came in and called (what I'm thinking is the owner) by name and he knew all their names and joked with them. He and the cashier really seemed to know their customers which I think is great. We had a nice experience and will be back to try more of their food!

Glad we ordered from this place last night! We ordered a pepperoni deep dish pizza and mild wings. Delicious deep dish pizza! We were visiting in the area and decided to try this place because of the reviews. Wasn't disappointed at all! Great food and we had it delivered- food was still very warm!

I had a craving for a Chicago Dog. I remember when this location opened, and had quickly bookmarked this for a later date. Well, I am glad that I did.

Living in Illinois for nearly 20 years, I came to love the hot dogs there. I am weird, and get mine without onions or the neon green relish. I just can't do it. We decided on our order, and then we just stood there waiting for a moment. And continued to wait while the lady behind the register finished up stapling and organizing her previous tickets. When she finally said something, she was animated and friendly. 

My husband chose the Italian Beef with the spiciest peppers and 'wet'; and I of course chose my 'Chicago dog, 'not' Chicago dog and fries. They came out fairly quickly. The sandwich and the hot dog were both wrapped in paper, and the fries had their own little bag, which was twisted closed. 

The fries were thin, and fairly tasty but were not piping hot. My hot dog tasted like I remember them to be, and the Beef was good. Next time, he said that he would choose to have it dipped rather than just wet. This way it will be nice and messy! Yum. As I was getting ready to leave I noticed that they sell large bags of Jay's Potato Chips. Are you serious?! I could not get over there fast enough to buy a bag. The price on the bag is exactly what I paid. That right there made my whole day. I have not had those for 17 years, and they were just as I remembered them to be.

Great pizza I even like it better than Gino's in Chicago. We had a chance to talk to the owner really nice guy and very down to earth. The sauce was great and the groupon was a plus we being from out of town would never had ventured of the strip if it wasn't for the groupons. One slice was enough to fill you up even with a salad prior. The cannoli's were great as well nice flavor to them. Not alot of places have cannoli's and if they do they are yuck. The only reason is wasn't 5 stars is the girl at the counter was rude and had the personality of a flea. Hope she has a great vacation since we had to hear about it. If we ever get back that way we will def stop again.

Best Pizza in Vegas!!!

I had the thin crust pizza and hot wings. 

Wings were spot on too, but the pizza is exactly what I've been looking for in the 3 1/2 years I've been in Vegas.
