There were some other diners having the Chicago style deep dish and they looked very happy too. I found this place by complete chance. I was trying to make a u-turn inside the target parking lot, when this place caught my eye. So I thought I'd give it a shot. As I walked in, the place was well lit, clean, spacious, and inviting atmosphere. They got extra points for having several flat screens with the game on. 

I'll be back for sure
This place was great.  We loved the wings, deep dish, chili cheese fries and the thin crust.

This was quite possibly the biggest let down I've ever had where food is concerned. My boyfriend hyped this place up so much saying there was nothing better than a hot dog from here.. but he hadn't been here in 10 years. Once I got the Windy City #1 hot dog I expected it to be the best thing on the menu because thats what the place is called, I was sorely mistaken. Everything was mushy and the hot dog tasted boiled, the only thing with a crunch was the pickle and that's all I could taste was pickle. Nothing looked fresh, the bun in fact looked like a corpse and fell apart like one too. In all honesty I could find a better hot dog at circle K. The best place to go is Steamie Weenie if you want a hot dog done right.
Great local, family owned shop. Staff is great and the food is excellent! Our family of four each had a different sandwich and all were splendid! Highly recommend.

I'm from Chicago and miss Chicago food but I love this place.  During lunch they have slices available but only until they run out of what they're made so the earlier the better.  I've had their beef sandwich wet with cheese and sweet peppers and it was superb.  I've had their Wednesday special:  beef and sausage combo and the flavor was just like home.  Had a slice of deep dish cheese pizza and it was great.  Tina is the hostess and order taker and is friendly.  Also recommend their cannoli's!  Fresh and crispy shell with delicious filling.  Did I say  I love this place??  Am just getting over my cancer battle and can't wait to get back there.

This is really a Chicago style restaurant, with everything on the menu having that authentic Chicago flair.  The vibe is great and the people are real and friendly.  I would give them a straight up 5 stars, but I have to save something for the fancy foo-foo restaurants.
Go and have a tasty treat!!!

Sometimes I feel like all I'm doing with my life is waiting. Waiting for the next job, the next promotion, the next relationship, the next benchmark that will forever sever gestation from the accolade, the rehearsal from the remuneration. And I was made vividly aware of this when I placed an order with Windy City Beefs N Pizza and had to wait for the Chicago style pizza delivered fresh to my door. It wasn't a long wait or anything, but I wondered, would I always be waiting? For my driver's license, for graduation, for my first real job, my wedding, my children, my mortal demise? Is it even possible to transcend?

Maybe we should embrace the now. Maybe it's time to stop longing for Summer, 2008 and seize the day in Las Vegas. Sure, the pizza is almost nothing like Chicago's Pizzaria Uno or Giordanos, but maybe that's the way life is meant to be, and the pleasures of Chicago are, like all things, ephemeral. And maybe it's time to stop waiting, stop wining that the world gave you mashed potatoes when you really wanted french fries, accept the hand you're dealt and play it like a man! And also, eat the pizza N beefs.

Truth is the food is either good or bad, the service is either outstanding or mediocre, so with that being said they get a well deserved 5 Stars. For a business that takes the time to get so personal and come to your table and talk to you, the various people you see walk in and WCBNP already know their order, that's building a great business, with delicious food to back it! First time being here, and their will be many more!
First time eating here. Delicious deep dish pizza and cannolis!! Friendly service. Will definitely come back!

Definitely gone down hill in terms of customer service & correct food order & correct deliver locations if you've ordered from different locations  in past...shame we like the food but be sure to double & triple check before you accept your orders! 
Tonight's order they delivered diet soda instead of regular then we realize the THREE hotdogs ordered without buns etc for dogs wasn't included but paid for...so then they return with the correct soda and ONE hotdog cut up saying that there were three and we would NOT be charged when in fact we had already paid cash and did not receive a receipt which also is annoying.
The delivery guy also said in future orders they wouldn't cut up the hotdogs nor would they be free! 
I never asked for them to be cut up & never asked for them to be free although when we first started buying from here the owner GAVE us free cut up hotdogs for my sweet Labradoodle Sonny...
We paid for three hotdogs as we now have three dogs and the deliver had one hotdog cut up and only two hotdog ends which was evidence it was only one! Nothing more I hate than a liar!
We are done with Windy City!

Pretty darn good! Once in a while I crave a deep dish slice. Deep dish here is  bit messy but pretty good. Stopped by for some takeout in the evening and got a small plain ("cheese") deep dish and an order of wings. 
If you come here for lunch, you can get slices, in the evening hours you can only get a pie. Tuesdays are 50 cent wings and they have pretty good deals other days as well. Be sure to pick up a deal calendar if you intent on coming back. 
Now to the nitty gritty, like I said the deep dish is pretty good. The dough is nice and fluffy and the edges are perfectly crusty. The pizza has chunks of sweet tomatoes and sauce on top, I prefer pizza with rather sweeter sauce so it was great for me. My bf hates to eat tomatoes and I thought he wouldn't like it but he did! He also loved the winds and came back for more the next day. The wings come in a variety of flavors but you should know that they are not tossed with the sauce. The sauce comes on the side. I though that would be a deal breaker for my bf since he is very particular about his wings but again, he loved it! His satisfaction definitely speaks to the quality of the food here.
Well thin crust is terrible.  But Chicago style is spot on. Will go there for the beefs and Chicago style for sure. The service isn't the friendliest.  But makes me feel like im back in chi lol
Had a gyro, and is one of the best ones I've ever had. I'm from Chicago so I'm critical when it comes to gyros, beefs, pizza and hot dogs. Still have to try the other foods here though.
What can i say. Great hospitality and great food. This will be one of my favorite spots when i visit vegas!!!

As a first time customer, I wish my experience with WCBP was better.  I called in to place a take out order and having never dined here before my Husband and I had a few questions on the menu.  While on the phone I paused for a moment to hear the question my Husband asked and the woman taking my order snapped at me saying "hey I've got a line of people here, so do you want to just call back or what?"  I literally paused my sentence for a whole 5 seconds.  When I picked up my food I got no thanks for coming in, nothing, and the food I ordered was average at best.  Oh and they forgot one of my sides of french fries.  Husband says Chicagoans are just curt by nature but we aren't in Chicago and a new customer shouldn't be treated with so much disrespect.

I have never had an Italian beef sandwich, but I can tell you for the rest of my life I will compare every one I eat to this one today. I'm a happy girl and will be back very soon. And everyone was so nice, Thank you.

I've been to this place 3 times now and my opinion has only gotten better, I tried the thin pizza this time, the sauce is awesome the crust was beautifully thin and what I call Well done". Next I will try the deep dish and I'm very excited about that. Can I add more stars

Winner, congratulations you have earned one star. If this review was just for the food I would have given them 4. Guess you don't want to catch them on a bad attitude day. Shame how one experience can lose a customer. Long story short (after a bunch of hassle and attitude) they left an item out of our to go order. Went back and they pretty much called us liars. We have eaten and enjoyed several of their pizzas. Threw the menu away and won't be going back. Fortunately there are lots of pizza restaurants in town that serve pizza without the attitude.
Best Chicago food , The Deep Dish pizza bomb , my favorite is the Chicago style hotdog and Maxwell polish. I will go there always..

The Italian Beefs here are a true representation of Chicago Beefs. I'm so glad I've found this place, it reminds me of home. The cashier at the front counter was extremely friendly and we hit it off because she knew about my home town. It felt good walking into a piece of Chicago in the middle of the valley.  I will definitely go back although the one cook thought I was too chatty and wanted me to "go home already" his own words, don't know if he knew I heard him but whatever homes .... I felt like I was at home. So...with that being said I'll see you next time with my chat box .
Consistently great Chicago Pizza and Vienna Beef Hotdogs!!! I will always bring my girls as they too, love the pizza and friendly staff. Great desserts as well!!

Daaaayyyyymmmmm!!  Off the chain!!  I seriously can't wait to go there again, it was THAT good.  Everything was soooo bomb!  And the peeps that work there are hella cool and just totally awesome!

So, I've never had Chi-style deep dish before.  I love deep dish, but I'm so effing picky, and I've never had the real thing before.  OMG.  I can pretty much die happy now.  Windy City is now my fav pizza EVER.  And I'm a fat boy, so I've eaten a lot of pizza, serious.  

The sauce, bomb.
The crust, bomb.
The cheese, bomb.
The other layer of sauce, bomb.
the other layer of cheese, bomb.

Perfect pizza.  

Plus you can totally just chill there eat, have some beer, and watch whatever game is on.  Oh, FYI you better root for Chicago.  :D
Tried to find a really good Chicago deep dish pizza place in Vegas, and I think we found it. Sauce was full of flavor, tons of cheese and buttery crust. Will definitely being having this again!

FYI Grand Opening is today & all dine-in orders are 50% off 1/25/13 til 10pm! Why are you still reading this, go there now! This is an update for a multi meetup event on 1/17/13. If you look at the pics I posted (the ones with the signs that say what each pizza is) you will see an amazing variety of pies. 

The owners Tim and Dakota were very accommodating, they met with our organizers a week prior to discuss the setup and what we expected. Even though they do not have salads on their menu, they went out of their way to provide us with a large tossed salad so we could have it served with our pizzas. Our group had it set up as "communal style" so we can try several different pizzas and there is something for everyone. Tim and Dakota set up some tables near the front and set it up buffet style, and brought out a couple different pizzas every 15 or 20 minutes so that the food was hot during the event. 

They had plenty of tables set up for our group of 32+ people, and there was plenty of room to move around and socialize. Their waitstaff was attentive and came over several times during the course of our event to check on us. We went to the counter to order our own beverages. They also allowed us to bring in beer and wine since their liquor license is not in yet. 

Everyone in the group was happy and it was a very fun time, nice atmosphere. Nice flat screens are on the walls and the room is brightly lit. Very positive feedback from all, I did not hear one complaint which is huge (because there is always one in every crowd). 

Here is what we ordered:
Thin Crust: 
Ultimate Veggie (green pepper, onion, mushroom and tomatoes) 
Sausage Classic (sausage, green pepper, mushroom, onion) 
White Pizza (olive oil, ricotta, garlic, tomatoes) 
Cheese 
Pepperoni/Bacon 
Pepperoni

Deep Dish: 
Cheese [note: this was REALLY GOOD!!! Cooked perfectly, gooey cheese, delicious sauce, oh my!!!]
Sausage/Onion 
Meat Special (Sausage, Pepperoni, Ground Beef & Bacon) 
WCBPN Loaded (Italian Sausage, Pepperoni, Mushrooms, Onions, Green Peppers & Black Olives) 
Ground Beef/Mushroom

FYI they don't have the NBA or Ice package but when your sports games are on regular TV this is a great place to watch some sports. I will be back with a group to watch the Chicago Bulls and Blackhawks games because it IS "Windy City pizza!"

The #4 Chicago dog and small beef really hits the spot. The giardeneria is a home blend that makes your taste buds awake with excitement. Being from Chicago I highly recommend this place to satisfy your craving for a taste of home. If you're not from Chicago I recommend this place to see exactly what you've been missing your whole life.

Came in and ordered food to go, a beef and wings.  I asked her 3 times to make sure the BBQ sauce was on the side and in the bag...

I get home and there was no sauce...how incompetent can a person be?

Last few experienced here have not been good...

Time to find a new place.. the food is good when prepared properly, but just way too many hit and misses to continue to give this place my business.

This place feels so much like Chicago, I almost feel like I have the need to throw on a thick mustache and aviator sunglasses. The food's great and it feels like home, and even better than that is the service. They make you feel important by at least trying to remember your name, even if it's the second or third time heading over there. I'll always come back!
Best Chicago style pizza in Las Vegas! It's been a while since we have had something that "claims" to be Chicago style actually lives up to the name.

As an ex Chicago citizen I crave my beef but they are hard to come by in SoCal. When I was in Vegas recently I searched for Chicago style food and found this place. I'm so glad I took the 10 mile trip. I had the Italian beef sandwich hot and dipped and it was one of the best beef sandwiches I ever had and I've eaten a ton of them in my lifetime. The place looks like most any other beef and dog place in Chicago. The sandwich was huge. Ordered the beef, fry and drink special and I think it was about $11.00. Worth every penny. Can't wait for my next Vegas trip.

First of all, I know everyone from Chi-town and NYC won't ever admit that the food is as authentic as from their home city. Okay, well get over that! This place is legit coming from a guy who loves Portillos, Super Dawg, and Hot Dougs. Their Chicago dog tastes the same has Portillos. I used to do business in Chicago, so I went their a lot and had the usual Chicago staple. The irony is that my friends from Chicago don't eat Chicago dogs, Deepdish pizza, and Italian Beefs on a daily basis which I probably ate more Chicago food than them. I recommend this place for the Chicago dogs because I haven't tried the Italian beef like Al's in Chicago.

Feeling homesick for Chicago? Come here.  Hawks, Bears, Bulls, Sox, and Cubs banners and pictures decorate the walls and they have Vienna Beef hotdogs made Chicago style.  The pizza is the best I've had in the area and the staff are so friendly.  They also have different specials everyday which are always fantastic deals.  I love coming here and it's probably my favorite restaurant in the area.

Ahhh ok.. customer service could be a little better here... especially when you are from the midwest usually super friendly and talkative... here you seem to be wasting someones time while small talking waiting for food. And fries are over cook and salty... but a hot dog is a hot dog so couldn't really go wrong... will visit hot dog haven better food friendlier just a little further but worth it!

As someone who has a current CTA Chicago Card Plus at the time I write this I know a thing or two about some things Chicago. And I have to admit I like Windy City Beefs N Pizza. I haven't tried their pizza yet....which as a Pizzaholic means I'm seriously slacking. (And if Jaime W. recommends it, I gotta try it!) But when I only had time for a fast lunch Windy City's #4 Best of Both Worlds 3 Inch Beef Sandwich and a classic Vienna Beef hotdog with no obnoxious ketchup fit the bill just fine. And unlike stopping at a cart along the street Windy City has tables to sit at so you can take your time and enjoy your food. 

This is a nice little slice of Illinois right here in Vegas. Well worth your time to check out. 

(Yelp 100 in 2013 Challenge #14)

I'm sure there's some joke that begins with "This New York food-snob walks into a Chicago Hotdog place...."
Well, NY & Chicago have two well-known food battles:  NY Pizza vs. Chicago Pizza & New York Hotdogs vs. Chicago Hotdogs.  You know what? Who cares which one is better, it's the most delicious food battles ever!  While I haven't found any good places for NY style hotdogs, this place makes GREAT Chicago style hotdogs.  
I'm so happy this place is right down the street from me.  The second I walked in and the smell hit me, my stomach started smiling.  I was intimidated by the menu because there are so many things I want to try.  My good buddy from Chicago came with me and said it's the closest he's had to real Chicago style food he's found in Las Vegas.
I ordered the Chicago Style hotdog and the Maxwell Polish Sausage(Spicy).  The lady behind the counter asked if I wanted fries, I declined, but she threw some in for me anyway.  Damn her!  I'm trying to watch my weight lol. Needless to say, everything was awesome!  
The hotdog had snap, great flavor and the polish sausage was grilled with a nice amount of char on it and was just awesome.  Fries were great too.  
I allow myself one day a week to eat unhealthy food and Windy City will probably be seeing me for the next two or three weeks.  I want to try the Pizza Bites, Tamales, Thin-crust Pizza and Stuffed Crust Pizza.  They have Cheli's Chili.  I'm a huge Hockey fan and that's Chris Chelios' Chili company...he was a defenseman for the Chicago Blackhawks for those not familiar.  I can't wait to try it all!

Best thin crust pizza we have found!  Crust is crispy, sauce is very good and lots of cheese!  I always order a triple sausage, as love, love their sausage. Hubby orders specialty pizza with everything and says best he has ever tasted.  We bring out of town visitors here all the time.  Guests have had the wings (fantastic), deep dish pizza (wonderful), beef sandwich (the best ever) and Chicago dog (just as good as in a Chicago).

I'll keep this short and sweet, because that's exactly what Tim the owner would want. Simple into the point. It's everything you want in Chicago style pizza and beef shop. Go here and get a deep dish pizza. Then go again, and get a dipped Italian beef. After that, you'll be hooked. It's like a little slice of Chicago in Vegas.

This is authentic Chicago. More precisely, authentic Elmwood Park, the west suburban Italian enclave. Th Chicago-style hot dogs are dead-on & delicious. The beef sandwiches are almost as good as Johnnies - home of the best beef on Earth (in Elmwood Park, of course). 

The sautéed peppers are superb; the only thing holding it back is the bread - definitely not Gonnella's, but really good anyway. If you want to know what a real Chicago Italian beef tastes like, go here. It's an experience everyone should enjoy at least once in their lifetime.

Every time I get food here it's just plain indulgently delicious. The ingredients are quality fresh and plenty. Highlights was the sauce and large chunks of meat and veggies yum! The deep dish pizza was so heavy I almost had to carry it with two hands. I was intimidated by it when I opened it and could only eat one slice but wow I have to say it just might be one of if not the best pizza I've had here in Vegas.

I'm a pizza nut & I've been in Henderson for 5 years & ordered from every spot in the valley. Hands down, WC is the best pizza you can get delivered. Asked for the pizza well done & was delivered perfectly. If you order Angelina's or one of the other clown companies that have 500 items on the menu, you're an idiot & you'll regret it.

Not bad at all. Came here today, my husband got the Italian sausage sandwich and I got the Chicago style hot dog. Both came with fries. I liked the flavor. It did remind me of the Windy City. The staff is friendly.

I LOVE MALNATI'S pizza in Chicago.  So, we were in Las Vegas - I looked for a place to have deep dish pizzal - Chicago Style.  It took a bit to find this place as it is tucked in to a corner in the shopping center (next to Office Depot) look for the umbrella patio tables.  The people were very friendly and the place was clean and decorated with tons of Chicago stuff.  My husband had the Chicago dog and it was spot on and delicious.  He wanted to try the Maxwell polish too, but was full from the dog.  I tried the deep dish and it was wonderful.  They do a fantastic job on the crust and the cheese.  The tomato could have been a little more chunky (I am used to 6 in 1 course ground).  BUT - this place is great.  I wish them all the best because they have great food and great people serving it.

I have come here a a couple of times due to their groupon that they consistently have up. I normally get their thin crusts and I have gotten their deep dish on one occasion. 

I have gotten multiple thin crusts here,  and they have always been good. I normally settle with a cheese and a sausage and pepperoni. I wish the cheese had more cheese, but it is still tastey. You can actually taste the sauce, which has good flavor, and the meats that they use have a nice flavor and don't make the pizza greasy like other places.

I tried their cannoli, which was tastey for a Chicago pizza joint. Their regular salad tasted like it was out of a salad bag kit, nothing special, but not necessarily bad either. 

My only gripe is their deep dish. It is more like a Pizza Hut pan pizza, which isn't what you would want when you are expecting Chicago style deep dish. I don't plan on getting it again when I return. Other places in town like Amore Taste of Chicago makes a way better pizza with a legit deep dish crust.

Overall, a decent place to get pizza. I'll continue to buy their groupon for their thin crust, and possibly buy their other menu items, like their sandwiches, sausages, and hot dogs, when I see something that catches my eye.

I lived in Chicago for about 5 years, so when someone says "Chicago----" I instantly get my Grumpy Skeptical face on. 

Windy City Beefs...well, they have Pizza Puffs. They have neon green relish, sport peppers, no ketchup. Yes, exactly. 

I prefer some other "deep dish" pizzas to Windy City, but for dogs and beef and puffs, this place sates the Chicago longing cravings. 

Pros:
- Good food, good prices, good folk.
- Chicago Style Hot Dogs. Done right. 
- I like the fries. I seldom like fries. Crispy outside, fluffy within.
- PIZZA PUFFS.
- My husband can get his Lost Chicago Beef.

Cons:
- When it gets busy, there can be a wait. Which...you should really have expected, since it's not fast food. But in case you didn't....
- Pizza has more edge crust and less butter than I like in my Chicago style.

The Italian beef is absolutely to die for.  I'll try it extra hot next time.  Have also had the hot dog "with everything", it was good.  I'm not much of a hot dog fan, but had the $3.99 special so I tried it.  Will have to try the pizza next time.  Great place.
Best deep dish pizza I've had in Vegas. The customer service is awesome. They were very engaging and made me feel at home. I'll definitely come back.

The 2 stars are for the Italian beef sandwich. Now to be fair I am comparing this to Portillo's in Chicago. So compared to there Italian beef, Windy city had very little flavor to the beef and I also had it wet which also brought very little flavor to the Sandwich. We also got the loaded Chicago style pizza to take with us which I give 4 stars, Would have been 5 but there was sliced carrots in it. They didn't cook soft so there was a crunchy piece of carrot in every other bite. Had to be a mistake, who puts carrots in a pizza pie. I would go back for the pizza without carrots, but not the beef sandwhich.

Chicago themed.. So it has to be good! ;) They have a big projection screen to watch all the best games, along with a few more TVs on the wall. Decent specials for football & Blackhawks games. Pizza is good.. Wings are delicious. I wish they had cheese sauce! :( Owner & staff are all real friendly. We'll definitely be back.

All I can say is that when I ordered the wings, I was thinking that the chicken that they malnourished.  And, I thought they were also overcooked.  Next, I thought the price was very expensive for 12 pieces of undersized overcooked wings.

Once I got them on the plate, I can tell you that the wings were some of the most tender, simply flavored and delicate wings i have had. i really enjoyed them.  The waitress also said that on Saturdays, they do wings and a pizza for a special price and on Tuesday's it is .50 per piece.  I am coming back for sure.

The sauces for the wings are mild to hot and while I really like hot sauce, the wings were so tasty, I had them mostly plain.

We came here really for the Chicago pizza.  We had the loaded pizza on a thin crust.  The pizza was cut is squares and i am told that is how it is always done in Chicago.  The pizza was great and the vegetables in this loaded pizza were some of the best, crunchy instead of soggy!  I am coming back here for the deep dish!

Besides this, they have a variety of sausages and hot dogs. I haven't tried them yet, but it sounds really good.  The only problem is that for me, it is all about wings, then pizza and hot dogs / links / sausages are the 

Like I said, I will be back for the deep dish and then on a Tuesday, so I can have more wings.

GK says check it out!

I must start by saying, WINDY CITY BEEFS N PIZZA HAS AMAZING CUSTOMER SERVICE.  While I was standing in line to place my order, I was watching the employees interact with the customers.  The employees were calling each customer by there name, which say a lot about this establishment.  The customers come here enough to build rapport with the employees.  It was our first time here and when we approached the counter the lady was very helpful, patient, and made good suggestions.  They bring your food to your table and they checked on us to see if we needed anything.  Food was really good and served in large portions.  The have a good selection on the menu.  I will be back to try so many other things that caught my eye!!!

For being in a small strip of a larger shopping area, we were surprised by how large Windy City was on the inside.  Lots of tables, and they are spread out so you aren't on top of your fellow diners.  Also, the place was clean, from the dining area to the bathrooms to what I could see of the kitchen.  

We had a medium deep dish pizza, which takes about a half hour to cook, so be advised.  We got the meat special (sausage, pepperoni, bacon, beef) and I got some hot giardinera on the side.  This pizza is, in a word, enormous.  We brought it home with us and easily had enough for a second meal.  The crust is flaky and not heavy or doughy.  It definitely contained all of the toppings, which can be an issue with this style of pizza.  The sauce is thick and flavorful, clearly homemade.  The toppings were plentiful and of good quality.  The bacon was probably my favorite, it was thick cut and you get large chunks of it, not tiny chopped up slivers.  It didn't have much heat, so the giardinera was a welcome burst of spice.  

At home, heated in the oven it was just as good if not better than it was the day before.  You may balk at the price, but you get a LOT of food, and it's great quality, AND it heats up well the next day.  You can't beat that in my book.

So...  YUM!

A 14" deep dished, Chicago style pizza gave two of us three meals!  It was too good to walk away from, we ate every bite over the course of our vacation.  The sauce was chunky, with big pieces of tomato - loved it.  Threw a couple pieces in the oven day two and day three and it was perfect all over again!

Started with a salad, nothing exceptional except the freshness.  Every piece crisp and perfect.

Desert cannoli was big, sweet and really tasty.

Service was friendly and the shop was interesting and clean.  This was clearly a local favorite and if I were a local, it would clearly be my favorite, too!

I have been coming to this location and the one in Summerlin for some years now. We are from Chicago. I just left from picking up an Italian beef and fries to bring home for lunch. The beef did not taste of the high end quality that I usually taste and I'm not so sure why they are super stingy with the fries. 
I probably will still go back because this is the first time I was not 100% satisfied....will purchase an extra order of fries for now on.

Oh my yes... Amazing. No comparison. This place is affiliated with the one up north (5 stars as well). Amazing  Italian beer, sausage, pizza, Chicago staples, etc. if you're from Chicago, you need to stop in. They have a big screen tv that shows all the Chicago games when they're on. Ample seating and seating outside as well.

Love this place and have been going there since it opened!
Rather disappointing though that they don't have a kids menu! I see a lot of families in there and I'm surprised nobody has mentioned this before!
We were in there tonite with our grandkids ages 2 and 4 and fir hotdogs and beef sandwiches it was $43! And the kids only ate half their food! 
Too bad Windy City isn't more family friendly!

Wow, wish I would have tried this place sooner! 
I had the Italian beef and sausage sandwich, so good, messy, but worth it! Special thanks to Sasha for bringing me here! Very friendly staff and owner too. Yum yum

I've had this place bookmarked for a while now and when my hubby and my mom wanted lunch one day I knew they'd dig this place. 

First of be prepared to wait or call it in first. Since I checked their menu out via Yelp prior I knew exactly what we wanted to order. I ordered the # 4 which is the Vienna Chicago Dog and a 3inch Beef Sandwich which I had them dip in the au jus. Joel ordered the #10 which was a full sized Beef Sandwich dipped with sweet peppers and cheese. I brought mine home to share with my mom and Joel took his back to work. By the time I got home I had a phone call from Joel saying how epically awesome the sandwich was! The taste was truly like Chicago! The hot dog yum! The snap of the meat and the sport peppers added the perfect spice. The meat on the sandwich was thin and tender. Mmmmm we've been talking about it ever since. 

Other then the long wait you can't go wrong with Windy City. I can't wait to go back to try the pizza and another sandwich. Great flavor  and huge portions are assured you in every bite!

This place makes a wonderful CHICAGO DOG. 
Ten minutes drive from the Strip. 
A 16" sausage dog is yummy. 
Beef sandwich is generous. 
Nice Mom and Pop shop. 
Next door to Mexican and Asian. 
Outdoor seating is available. 
We make a point if eating here every time we visit Vegas

Wow.. just wow.

This place is amazing..  Their deep dish pizza is out of this world delicious. I had the 14 inc with pep and sausage. The sauce and the crust are just untouchable. This is now my favorite pizza in the entire valley. 

The service was also really good. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The environment of this place is also really cool. Just a very chill and relaxed place to stop in and have a great meal.

The last notable mention is that the prices are also really good. The deep dish came out to around 20 and easily fed three people with an extra slice left over.. Damn good way to spend twenty bucks.

I can't say enough about how much I like this place. The food is always great, without fail. The staff is so nice and treats you like family. Whenever I go out for lunch, I think about going here. Hot dogs, deep dish pizza, or my personal favorite, Italian beef sandwiches. I would recommend Windy City to anyone.

Great deep dish pizza.

I've only been there once so far, but the deep dish pizza was so good! For dessert we had chocolate covered cheesecake on a stick! Love this place. Can't wait to come back and try the other items on their menu.

I ordered a pop with my meal and didn't get questioned!

Sometimes you just want a hamburger with that Chicago flavor, pizza puff, or liquid cheese for your fries.  That kind of stuff isn't easy to find in Las Vegas.  Food is pretty good here.  Honestly a little bit pricier than what you would be used to back home in Chicago, but hey, we're in Vegas now... what do you expect!  Chicago hot dog that I've gotten on a couple of occasions is just OK.  I have yet to try the pizza, but looks pretty good.

The thing I like most about this place though is the feel.  The place made me miss home with all the Chicago memorabilia everywhere.  Love the big old Taylor sign that they have on the wall since I spent my college years at UIC living off Roosevelt and Taylor.  I'll be coming back just so I can try more of the menu.
Wow! The best beef I've had since we visited Chicago! My husband is from Chicago and  has found his spot for that hometown feel! Try the beef dipped with hot peppers! Can't go wrong!!!

I am from the east coast and accustomed to the best pizza in United States ;) however, Windy City brings a little comfort and reminders of pizza from home. 

I had the thin crust Hawaiian and it was pretty good, a bit sweet for my taste but nonetheless still a damn good pizza. I will visit again but if I had a chance to give a suggestion, I would offer a regular crust option.

Only place in town to get a beef just like back in the CHI! Staff is always nice and knows me by name, just like back home. Forget the rest in town who try and say there authentic Chicago and try the best, at a fair price and large portion. A+++++ business.

FINALLY made time to trek all the way across town to give Freddy's/Nielsen's/Windy a run for *my* money LOL!

I've been hearing a lot about their Deep Dish here...so that's what I ordered!

Chicago Deep Dish : Half Pepperoni / Half Italian Sausage :

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/windy-city-beefs-n-pizza-las-vegas?select=KALsdp8z4anIuvinXKOJJg#KALsdp8z4anIuvinXKOJJg

The crust here is great, buttery, crispy outsides, slightly chewy insides, with a great hearty tomato sauce and tons and tons of cheese hiding inside!  This tasted much better than the "other" place on Durango that was highly recommended to me....so good!

But it wasn't all perfect.  The toppings tasted a bit cheap...possibly frozen or store bought?  For all the love I tasted in the crust/sauce/cheese, I expected more.  The pepperoni looked like they came out of a lunchables box, and didn't have much seasoning or flavor and no crispy consistency...soft and chewy.  Sausage was ok, but I have been jaded with other pizza places in town, with home-made house sausage that has a bunch more flavor and spice...this one was hiding in the sauce and didn't make a statement.

But everything else was great, even reheated for leftovers...the true test for great pizza!  I ate pizza for the next two days because the pie was too much!

A bit spendy...I think I spent around $18 for this 12in deep dish.  I don't mind spending good money for great food, so it wasn't a bother...just expect it.

I recommend checking it out!  I just won't be making the 45min drive again anytime soon...or just have to find the right toppings to make a legendary za!

This is a great place.  Low on pretense, high on delicious.

The atmosphere is basic and functional with lots of Chicago-bilia on the walls and if its baseball season, a Cubs game on the TV.

But the food is where this place shines.  The deep dish is every bit as good as in Chicago, and the dogs are authentic (although there is ketchup on the table!).  Even the salad is an authentic midwestern dish; iceberg lettuce and some onion, what the heck else do ya want?!

Allow 25 minutes for the pizza to cook, it is worth the wait.

Really casual place with really great food.  I really love the concept and appreciate that its a family business.  If you know anyone looking for a part time job, have them drop off a resume.  While the lady that manages the place is great, you can tell its an uphill battle for her trying to manage the goons in the kitchen.

This place is home away from "Sweet Home Chicago". Seriously, if you didn't go outside and feel the desert heat you would think you were in a typical Chicago style fast food joint.

I've had most everything here except the pizza and I can tell you it's all the real deal. Hot dogs, beef, Italian sausage, polish, and gyros. It's all just as good as you'd get back in Chi town.

My favorite meal here is the gyros sandwich and I'm a real stickler on this. There are several places to get gyros here in the valley, but if you want the real deal Chicago style gyros this place has it and does it right. They use real shaved off the spit gyro meat on a lightly grilled pita with onions, tomato, and tzatziki sauce- and that's it! No lettuce, olives, feta cheese, weird herbs, or funky dressings like some other places serve it. At last I've found a decent gyro in Vegas!

Also, nice people working there. Good service, Chicago sports on the TVs, and plenty of pictures and memorabilia on the walls to make you homesick.

I only wish they were closer to my house.

Relaxed atmosphere. Found this place after searching on the Internet where to watch the Blackhawks games in Vegas. Although thru the first 10 games or so we have been there about 5 games.. There hasnt been many hockey fans which is good and bad.. Not quite a loud hockey atmosphere but at the same time its chill and plenty of room to see the big screen and 4 other tvs. The owner is cool we spoke to him for awhile while his brother was in the restaraunt. Very nice gentlemen and hawks fans from Illinois! I duno the workers name but she works alot an is really nice . Also they have random free hot dog giveaways  .. They put two random names onthe board and if its yer name u get a free hot dog! One of these hawks games days  hopefully itll say " Greg and Holly"

Oh my!  We had the thin crust and wings. Wings were crispy but not overcooked, with sauce on the side. Pizza was cut in squares and excellent!  Needed just a little salt, but that's just me.  He didn't use salt at all. Atmosphere could use a little help. Don't know if this is just how they do it in Chicago or it was just bad.  Bright and loud with too many tvs. Food was good enough to go back for tho. Good place for kids and sports fans. Loved it.

To preface this review, please keep in mind everyone has different thoughts about what Chicago style pizza is. This review is based on what the majority of Chicagoans consider Chicago Style. First time trying pizza here. I love Chicago style. 5 stars for flavor and service on the phone. Minus 2 stars for the make up of the pizza. I do not consider this true Chicago style. Chicago style is not about how much cheese you can put in it. The cheese and sauce should be about equal. The sauce should have tomatoes that you actually may have to brush off of the top of the pizza. My pizza from here was overloaded with cheese. Very good but, not enough sauce to go with it. The depth was lower than expected. They make it look good due to the cheese pulling away from the rest of the pizza. A good show but, the make up of the pizza was poor. Flavor gets 5 stars. Very flavorful. Girl on the phone was Haley. She was fantastic!! Very nice. Very sweet. Very helpful. Also, their menu shows the largest deep dish pizza is 14 inches. Says on menu 21.50. That is until you put toppings on. I had 4 toppings plus Giardiniera and it was over 31.00. They should have prices on that page for toppings and should also say 21.50. Toppings extra !
I am guessing they have pizzas with certain toppings already added but, guess I did not look around the menu enough to find them. Overall it was a decent experience. I will continue to look for good Chicago style pizza here around Vegas /Henderson. This one was tasty, just not TRUE Chicago. Eating true Chicago style involves one of two things; a slice held in hand should be a mess or you put it on a plate and use a utensil. This can be held in the hand and eaten like any other pizza. And the crust should not be quite as thick as this one was. But, still was very good. In a pinch I may grab another from here.
 Thank you Haley!

Best Chicago deep dish I have found yet. Very cheesy and needs a fork and knife like it should. For Chicago deep dish.... This is our first choice.... Now to find new York style pizza and good Chinese good or whole we are in Henderson and I'll be super happy.

Best Italian beef in Vegas!  Was going to take pictures but the food looked and smelled so good it never had a chance... the pizza puff took me back to jr high. Added some pics from my second visit. Poor beef didn't last long enough this time either.

I've been craving some chicken wings lately and found this place on Yelp with a lot of good reviews, decided to give it a try. It's bigger than it looks from the outside and there were probably around a dozen people dining inside on a Sunday evening.

Woman at the counter and guy who later handed me my food were stone faced and not very welcoming. A little over $10 for a dozen wings. They came out almost instantly, which sounds good, but means they were probably sitting under heat lamps. 

In the car they didn't even smell good, like old grease. They tasted a little better than they smelled, but nothing special. Came with a side of also very greasy fries. Their hot sauce is Frank's, and their medium tastes like Frank's diluted with ranch. 

I may come back to try their beef sandwich or pizza, which is their main deal, but not for wings.

Cool joint that has deep dish pizza, promising "Chicago-style". My boyfriend's family lives in the Chicago area, so I experienced the pizza there firsthand during Thanksgiving week. That being said, this pizza definitely had a good flavor. But the crust just isn't right. It only took 20 minutes which already made us skeptical because deep dish in Chicago takes 45.  I was told in Yelp Talk that it must be because of the water that they can't make it as thick and "pastry-like", which is a shame. But it was definitely stil good, so I don't wanna diss; I'm sure they tried their best being in the middle of the desert! 

I guess I will have to order Giordano's online or go to Chicago to get it the way I want it!

From a Chicagoan.....wow. Pretty damn good deep dish pizza.  They did forget my salad dressings for the salads. But fuck it. Didn't really want to waste good stomach real estate on salad anyway. Very very very good.  Will be going back for the Chicago dog and Italian beef sandwiches.
The only place in town to get good pizza. Everything here i have had is good hot dogs beef sandwiches.  Very casual freindly and very good food

My dad is a native of Chi-town so he knows his pizzas. I've lived in Illinois for a few years as well so I'm acquainted with the Windy City's style (which kind of made me a bit picky about pizzas). 

The place has a pretty spacious eating area decorated with Chicago sports memorabilia. They also offer free hot dogs if you have their name of the day. Too bad my middle name didn't count for today's name of the day.

Their dogs are great and there's lots of combinations available if you're in the mood for a slice of pizza or Italian beef. They even offer Green River at this place too.

We took a deep dish pizza with us home and  I was stuffed after one slice. Since my mom doesn't eat meat my dad and I are gonna have a hard time finishing this thing by ourselves!

Only advice I might add is that they only have 1 or 2 ladies (who are nice) taking orders so be patient the food is worth it. :)

I have never had Chicago deep dish pizza before. I had to miss Michael K.'s UYE here a couple of weeks back. So after work one day I was craving pizza. I asked one of my coworkers who comes from Chicago to come with me. 

What we ended up getting for $35 was ridiculous. An order of wings with fries and a large pizza with the works was too much food for two grown men. In fact, we finished the wings and barely got through a slice before tapping out. Deep dish is no joke. The crust is not dense or doughy and held up to all the moisture that the veggies released. When they say the works, they mean it. Each slice is layered with massive amounts of ingredients. Ours basically had everything from their line. 

Don't worry, when you pack it up to go, it only gets better the next day.
Recently went to Chicago for the first time and loved the hotdogs. Came back home and found this great place close to my house. They are great. I'm not a Chicago expert, but I did really like them.

I'm sorry Chicagoans', it's not my thing. Hubby got us a couple Chicago dogs with fries. I liked the bun and the fries, but that was about it. I don't like the thick skinned hot dogs they sell and they don't have much flavor. Hubby ate the rest of my dog, he digs them.
Service was good, restaurant was clean and comfy, nicely decorated with Chicago sport teams. 
I won't go back but it's just my taste preference.
Awesome Chicago deep dish pizza!! The crust is so good! Crunchy and buttery with the right amount of dough. Will be ordering from again.

We are from Chicago and wanted to try this place to have a little taste of home. The Chicago style hot dogs are great tastes just like the ones back home! The fries were good as well. Didn't try the deep dish so can't comment on that. $2 beer deals with Chicago beers was good. They even have green river soda which was awesome. 

Only reason for 4* is there is no changing table for a baby in the bathroom which was disappointing.

I was NOT impressed.  Thank God we had a Groupon because if I would have paid full price I would have been livid. The salad was mediocre at best. The dressing looked like mayo and the pizza was all dough. I do not recommend this place at all.
The pizza is great! Hotdogs, always delicious. Don't order ketchup on your hotdog ;) get your beef wet the #4 is my go to combo!

I love the Chicago dogs and deep dish. Sometimes when you take home the dogs the bun can get a little soggy, same with the fries. Sometimes the pizza sauce is runny and can make the pizza and box soggy as well. Flavor is what gives this place the 3 stars cuz the presentation and customer service is definitely lacking. The women who work there usually have a bad attitude and i find myself feeling tension when I get up to the counter. I try to be as nice as possible and smile but nope nothing back.
Best Chicago deep dish pizza and combination italian beefs for sure. Nice place to sit and enjoy the games.

Very impressed with this place. I waited a long, long time to try it because I assumed it was the old hot dog place that used to be next door. Haven't tried the pizza but it looks awesome. I had the #13 which is a sandwich loaded with Italian beef and Italian sausage...highly recommended!
This place has the best deep dish pizza I've ever had!

I have been to WCBNP twice in the last couple of weeks. The deep dish pizza for takeout was good and went back yesterday to try italian beef and hot dog combo with Jays potato chips...also good.  The customer service here is way better than Chicago hot dog joint that use to be in the same strip and I wont need to go to Heavenly Hotdog anymore with WCBNP being close to my house. Happy Days!
P.S. Elis Cheesecake available as well.

This is the best place for Chicago style pizza! Not only is it yummy, they have an awesome team who cares about service. It makes me miss home in the Midwest even more. Give them a try, you won't be disappointed!

I love this place. I think I may have lived in Chicago in a past life, and they serve all of the gteat Chicago comfort foods. Their Chicago hot dogs use Vienna Beef (which is a requirement) and they are reasonably priced! They also have an amazing Gyro and Italian Beef sandwich. Everything is made to order exactly the way you want it. My favorite is the Italian Beef and Chicago Dog combo. It is the best of both worlds!  This is one of those restaurants where I want to try everything on the menu but I always order the same thing because it is amazing.

The ambiance is nice and fits the restaurant perfectly.  Best Chicago food and hot dog joint in the Henderson area!

Sad face, happy stomach. Windy City Beefs and Pizza is where I go to get a taste of Chicago. The atmosphere looks like the spots I grew up eating at. The food is great, the staff are from the "city" and you can tell that many of the other guest hail from Chicago as well. I had the Italian Beef dipped. WHOA!

ermagawd.

I came here with my grad school pal to celebrate the fact that one of us is graduating this semester (not me).  She loves her some Windy City Beefs because she's a Chicago gal and they have the deep dish pizza here.  Plus, everything about this place screams, "I love Chicago!"  Sports banners, posters, pictures are all dedicated to the Windy City--duh.  Michael Jordan looked down on us from the wall as we dined.
Did we eat anything remotely healthy?  No.  OK, I had bottled water, Windy City bottled water at that.  And then, there were fries and a shared Chicago deep dish pizza, half cheese and half mushroom.  But, you don't come here to eat healthy.  You come here to eat like Chicago people, which means you're committed from the start, diets be damned.  So, I thoroughly enjoyed the fries and two slices of that deep dish deliciousness--the crust is wonderful!  And then I got stuck with taking home the leftover pizza because my pal said she's on a diet--WTH?!  Guess I'm on a diet again, too.
Finally found a place in Las Vegas for Chicago style hot dogs and Italian beef sandwiches, just sorry I live across town.  I love the comb beef and sausage sub too.

If you understand the concept of Chicago themed food than you'll be in for a treat.  This is the closest you can come to enjoying a Chicago hot dog, beef sandwich, and even deep dish (in the Henderson/South LV area)  without having to road trip it to Portillo's in Az or Ca.
Delicious WINGS! non breaded deep fried goodness!! Pizza was tasty but did not have enough sauce and a little too much cheese, which I normally wouldn't mind but it was a tad bit dry.

Finally came in to check this place out.  WHY didn't I come here earlier. This place is great.  Not a Chicago sports fan but I can ignore the decor haha.  The service was very friendly.... I got the #4 best of both worlds.  It's a Chicago dog, Italian beef sandwich and fries.  The Chicago dog was pretty good, but that Italian beef... Holy Crap that was delicious.. Got it with cheese, peppers and gardinera (sp) dipped.. Not sure if it was the jus dripping or if I was just uncontrollably drooling cause that was AMAZING.  I will most definitely be back here.

My first time visiting today for lunch.  I had the corned beef sandwich which was good (saurkraut was a little salty) and a bite of their Italian beef sandwich and that was good too.  The serving size is large and prices were great.  I will split a meal next time. Definitely suggest to my friends to try it out.
Great food and friendly staff. I will continue to come back. Can't wait to try the rest of the menu.
Windy City Beefs n Pizza has the best Chicago food and I love eating there. Their Chicago hot dogs are the best! Great atmosphere, great food and great prices.

Well im not one to complain bit im giving 3 stars snd this is why, My husband and i both worked all day so we were trying to decide where to grab something to eat. I was on yelp and saw the good reviews and saw that it closed at 900pm so we get there and its 7:40pm and we were trying to decide being our first time. My husband said he would start off with one and if he wanted another he would order another one and the lady at the counter with short brown hair said... No you better decide now because we close in 20 minites so your not gonna sit here and buffett all night! oh my goodnes i coudnt believe it, i said it says on yelp u close at 900pm and she said yes  but we r slow so we r closing early! I said well we didnt know that.She really rubbed us wrong! Very nice place but dont know if we will be back because of this! I always say first impression could be last impresdion! I work in customer service and i would never say that!

Perfect place for pizza or lunch even dinner. Very affordable. And absolutely delicious. One of my favorite places in Henderson to eat! If u are looking for good variety of food with great taste and great price, try this place!! They will greet u with a smile.

If you're from Chicago, like I am, you'll love the beef,hot dogs and Maxwell Street polish.
The fries are great too. My favorite place for lunch.

We've tried their deep dish pepperoni pizza, and it was sooooooooo good! The pizza is so cheesy and have a good amount of pepperoni considering it was fair priced-not overly priced! The crust is crunchy and delicious too! We'll be back to try their wings!

Ho hum
The food is ok, the service was good, but over $10 a head for 2 hot dogs, greasy fries and a drink?
Me thinks not!

The deep dish pizza here is a serious letdown.  

The last time I was in Chicago I tried a deep dish I didn't like after taking a bad recommendation.  After seeing all the highly rated reviews from people from Chicago I was seriously excited to try this place.     

Here's why I didn't like the pizza:
-it wasn't hot when it came to us
-the dough tasted generic and store bought; it was simultaneously hard and soggy and not in the good way
-the tomatoes on top were flavorless 
-even with sausage and peppers, the whole thing was bland and flavorless

I will say that it had a good amount of good mozzarella.  It didn't taste like the cheap waxy stuff.

I wasn't sure I liked the service here either.  I came up to the register to place my order and I don't know...  I just didn't feel welcome.  You should want me to order multiple items and not keep cutting me off before I can.  I mean she wasn't rude but she also wasn't friendly or helpful.  If the menu says "creamy garlic Italian" dressing I say I want that one and you tell me you don't have Italian but I ask what is the creamy garlic Italian and you say it's creamy garlic... that doesn't help me.  In case any of you Yelpers want to know it's basically garlic mayonnaise (taste and consistency).

I have to admit before coming here I was not a deep dish fan. But after eating here my point of view has changed. Ok I'm done writing a review because its time for a afternoon nap. (In a good way.) Thanks WCBNP.

I've been meaning to do this for a long time. Coming from Chicago I'm very fussy about pizza. Windy City has THE BEST PIZZA ANYWHERE. I just don't mean Las Vegas or Chicago. Their crust and sauce are fantastic. They make the za amazing. But it doesn't matter if you get cheese or sausage it's coming out perfect. Sometimes I forgo pizza because their Italian Beef or sausage is great. Super hotdogs are on the extensive menu also. You can't go wrong.

Stopped in for lunch today and tried the original Chicago dog and Italian beef with au jus on the side; delicious food and we'll definitely be back again. When we walked in, the owner was helping clean up the tables which shows that he takes pride in his business and we appreciate that. The woman who helped us had a great attitude too. Don't forget a chocolate dipped cheesecake for dessert!

My favorite is a wet (with a spoon full of beef juice poured over) beef sandwich with mozzarella & peppers (they charge extra for each, but I like it). Delicious deep dish pizza, packed with toppings and the sauce is good. The Chicago dogs are okay.

Diane and I tried Windy City Beefs N Pizza for the first time and found its Italian Beef Sandwich and Chicago Dog to be as good as what is served at its sister property, Windy City Beefs-N-Dogs.  But her Canadian Bacon & Extra Cheese Pizza was burnt, very thin, inexplicably cut into small squares, and fairly pedestrian.  Money for the pizza was refunded after Diane turned down an offer for a new pizza, but a Corn Dog replacement was accepted.  No problem here, except the cashier refused to take any additional money for the Corn Dog.  

A #4 Windy City's Best of Both Worlds featuring a Vienna Beef Chicago Dog and a 3-inch Beef Sandwich yielded just the right amount of food to assuage my hunger.  The dog's relish was emerald green with zippy Sport Peppers, while the lean beef was tucked inside a soft bun with sweet Green Peppers and melting white cheese just dripping in juices.  Service, too, was excellent.

Frequent visitor of this as well as the lake mead location. Both are very friendly and have pretty much the same food but given the choice I prefer coming here especially if dining in. Much more spacious than the other one and also has the pizza has a menu  option. Either way though very good food and service.
I do love there food but the only people that were really welcoming is the older staff and I didn't like how the cashier was counting her tips in front of customers!! How unprofessional!
Excellent pizza with a down home feel. We had the Chicago deep dish pizza and it was exceptionally good. Great beer specials daily as well.
I grew up in shy town. This by far has great beefs. Clean and staff is very friendly. I make it a point to stop by when I past. Usually at least 3 times a month. Very good place

Their thin crust was horrible! The dough was bland, dry and so tough my kids couldn't bite through it. The sauce tastes of what I remember kids lunchables "pizza" tasted like. Staff member was not helpful at all when I told her it was my first time. Her response when I asked her for her recommendation was, "we have pizza and hotdogs."

Deep dish pizza done right and order it well done, because it's the way to go.  The cheesy goodness, pepperoni, sausage and mixture of peppers will leave you wanting more.  The well done will require more bake time, but so worth the wait for the crispier crust.  It's a total gut buster, but so worth the cheat meal.  Friday is the best deal, because it's buy one get the other for half off.

The Italian beef is pretty good when completely drenched in au jus.  The added spiced giardinera peppers gives it a nice kick.  You can get it dry too,but the 

I've never been to Chicago, but I really enjoy their deep dish pizza.  It's a loud environment, with good hospitality so it sounds pretty authentic.  If you don't want to head to the strip, this is the best bet. Get it?

Came here after I got a glowing recommendation from a friend and have been hooked ever since. 

Each time I have called in to-go orders for several of their deep dish pizzas for my family before hitting the road to Cali. They keep very well in a hot/cold bag during the trek home and heats up just fine in the oven. 

I've never been to Chicago but these are the best damn deep dish pies I've ever had. My usual is the WCBNP Loaded deep dish which comes with: Italian sausage, pepperoni, mushrooms, onions, green peppers, black olives & giardinera peppers (hot or medium). I get two pies, one with the hot giardinera peppers and one with the medium. The hot isn't super spicy but it has more kick than the medium ones and come with less green bell peppers. I believe you can also buy jars of their peppers at the front counter as well. 

The cashier is always pleasant and patient over the phone as I'm placing my order. She also gave us a calendar showing us various promotions and specials. Super nice and welcoming. My food is always ready or is being finished up by the quoted pick up time. I cannot recommend this place enough to my friends and family.

Great place to eat! Try #13 dipped!! It's the Italian Beef and sausage sandwich dipped and add mozzarella cheese. So gooooooood!! It comes with beef and sausage. Tried the Ruben, that was good as well. Took home a pizza, Chicago style deep dish pepperoni, very good! My son had the hot dog and he was pleased too! And the girl at the counter was really nice! She must get a lot of regulars, she new many ppl by name as they came into the door. We will definitely be coming back.

Didn't know what to expect walking in here after reading alot of the reviews. Assumed the food would be good but heard some bad things about the staff. Everyone was super friendly and super nice!! That might also be because they have only been open for an hour lol. Large deep dish pepperoni..DELICIOUS..I am not from Chicago so I can't compare it to true Chicago deep dish but the crust was flavorful..unlike some places I have been where all they care about is how thick they can make it....Order of wings...the BEST wings i have had in a looooong time!!! The mild sauce had just enough kick and was super flavorful and I love that they put it on the side so when you get home the wings are still super crispy and not all soggy!! Will definetly be back!!

Thanks to Michael K hosting his first UYE, I was able to experience the friendly service and awesome wings and pizza of this SE Chicago deep dished pizzeria.

The restaurant is located in a large strip mall on S.Eastern Ave and Silverado Ranch Blvd, so finding exactly where it is could be a minor challenge.  But that also meant there are plenty of parking to go around when you go.

By the time I arrived after going to WCBNP straight from work, the chicken wings were already at the table and the group was waiting for the Chi-Town deep dish pizza (which of course took longer to bake).  The wings were really good (I am not even sure what flavor wings were ordered, but that was the highlight for me.

The deep dish pizza that was brought to our table was big.  Really big.  Not sure if I could even finish it all if I was given two meals to attempt to eat it all solo.  The pizza is cut up into squares, so it is messy work eating the middle pieces.  Fork, spoon, spork, offset spatula would all be very helpful in eating this as cleanly as possible.  Having plenty of napkins to mop up the delicious oils on your hand afterward will help too.

Price was really affordable.  With our small group it was like $5 a person for the wings and pizza.  Can't beat that!

I can't see myself coming here solo to have pizza, but the wings are well worth the drive to this east side pizzeria.  Especially on Tuesdays with their $0.50 wings promo with a minimum order of 6.

Who is going to organize the next event here?

After several visits to Windy City since my initial visit, I'm still a fan. I have yet to try anything other than their deep dish pizza but I had the privilege of watching someone attempt and complete the Sears Tower Eating Challenge, which was disgusting and amazing all at once. The man was able to eat over seven pounds of Italian beef, sausage with peppers in bread with a side of fries. Someone really chose to attempt this? It was insane to watch but definitely entertaining. 

Can't wait to try more of their menu soon.
The deep dish Chicago pizza is awesome any day. Also try the Chicago beef wet with hot peppers. Awesome.  Same owners as the shop on West Lake Mead.  Worth the trip here for the pizza

Great first time here .. they serve Chi style pizza by the slice but l came for the Italian beef.. dipped , sweet n hot ! So awesome! And it beats the rude owner at Hot Dog Heaven on Water street.. l found my go to spot for Italian beef !!! Come here !!!

I love going to Windy City, especially on a Bear's game! Every time I order something different and every time I enjoy it. I wasn't that hungry tonight, so I just got a corn dog, a 312 Chicago beer, and fries. It was delicious.  Also, you won't find a better atmosphere anywhere else.  I'm coming back for Bull's games.
Great food. Eating there made me feel like I was at home in Chicago.  Nena is awesome.  Even got some food to go for my mom. Love this place!!!! Will most definitely be coming back!!!!
